reviewText:
[UPDATE]: Blacklight got a new developer and while they did not declare anything, we could expect an update for this game.

First and foremost, before skiping this review because it's negative and you don't like it, look at my hours on record with this game. If you don't have the patience to read a full review, I will narrow it down for you: the PC version of Blacklight has been abandoned by the developers, no update whatsoever, the bussiness model was ruined, the community came apart, there is seemingly no reason for you to play this game if you are new to it.

First let's talk about the bussiness model. Blacklight was appraised for their renting system which was really well made, in fact one of the great things about the old busineess model is that it allowed one day rental. Which was a thing that Blacklight did very well, in fact TotalBscuit was pretty impressed by it in a first impressions video. The fact that you could play two rounds of Blacklight and get a good gun was a pretty good deal, and it was appealing to the casual player. Now this has changed, one day rental is gone. This meant a pretty big deal to casual gamers, because that meant that they had to grind for certain weapon parts and premades. In the past, with 200 in-game points, you could buy a decent gun or a gun part for one day. This was all fine and good, but now you can only rent gun parts for three days, and gun premades for 7 days, which will cost you a lot more time and points. I love Blacklight, but even to me, the change of the bussiness model was a pretty big hit, having to play at least three or four games just to get my hands on a tiny side-grade gun part was not worth it in my book. Many people liked the idea of premade weapons, because Blacklight has a huge level of weapon customisation, and premades gave you a fully decked out rifle for very little points, and that was a good equalizer especially for new players who were pinned against level 40 players with access to the gun parts they desire. A newbie could just play a game or two, buy a premade and stand a very good chance against skilled players or even players who have invested money into the game. Now, there was something else that changed the bussiness model, and that is the weekly rotation system. Each week, a certain weapon receiver and hero character is available for free. This is a pretty good deal, not only it allows you to experiment with weapons and heroes, before buying them, but hero characters are very good and they have a good set of gear, which is pretty good for new players, but these hero characters cover a certain area of expertise: you have a tanky hero with a light machine gun, you got a stealthy hero with an SMG, and these don't really suit new players. The good thing is that they could make for a good alternative when you're new and you don't like the default gear, which is actually very good.

Now that we're done with the business model, let's talk about the items in the game. Most items are very well balanced, there is a wide variety of weapons and parts to chose from. But the probelm is that there hasn't been any sort of new content for the past year or so. When Blacklight celebrated a year of open beta, we had new maps, new guns, new parts, a zombie mode (which is pretty fun and challangeing), and all sorts of cool stuff. For the two year anniversary we got an XP event. That's it. The lack of new content is what drove a lot of pro players away from this game. Now, some people consider some items to be overpowered, or that some aspects of the game are pay to win, but that is not true. The game is nicely ballanced, the stuff considered overpowered is only better than average. The starter items are very good and reliable. The basic, starter assault rifle is still regarded as one of the best weapons in the game simply because of how well it performs overall. You can play this game without investing any money but it won't be very rewarding. Getting permanent items and weapons with game points is a huge pain and it takes a lot of time, and if you get bored easily, don't even bother playing this game. The developers pretty much abandoned the PC version long ago, and now all their focus is on the PS4 version of Blacklight, so you can expect no update for PC for a long time.

So far we've concluded that the bussiness model is kinda broken, the developers lost interest in this game and nobody has heard of any updates since forever. The progression isnt't rewarding, items are pretty hard to aquire. You must be thinking that there has to be a saving grace for this game, anything that makes it worth your time and effort. Maybe the community is nice? Maybe there are nice people you can play with? Wrong... The community has started falling apart a long time ago. Good players and nice people sarted losing interest in this game very quickly. Now there are very few good players left in this game. There is only  handfull of them out there, but they're there. You will encounter a bunch of annyoing stereotypes. There are newbies who don't know the game at all and accuse people of hacking, swear, pester, don't play the objective, that sort of stuff. There is the average player who does his best, gets a few kills, helps the team pretty well. And there's the die hard fan who is very good at the game and smply refuses to move on. As for real hackers, I can honestly tell you that in all the 412 or so hours that I have accumulated in this game, I have only seen two hackers. Two. So, you can take my word for it that hackers are an incredibly rare sight, but if you do see one, please message me. As for a small piece of advce if you are a player who likes being a part of the community, I suggest playing on any server and just interact with the people there. You will find a friendly person eventually.

Now, Blacklight is a game I continue to love despite of all the problems it has. I've had some great moments with it and I still hope that someday it will be back to its old glory. To sum it up, if you're new to this game, do not waste your time with it and do not even think about wasting your money on it. Unless you really like this game, there is no reason for you to play. Especially if you're a casual player. If you're playing like two to three hours from time to time, when you have a few hours for yourself in your busy life, the experience is not going to be rewarding. Not to mention that if you want to be able to build your dream weapon, you will have to make it to at least level 30, which is not an easy task. If you're hoping to maybe make friends in this game and have a good time overall, don't even bother. The community is very bad right now. But if you like being insulted for no reason, be my guest and play the game.

Thank you for your time, and I hope you take this review into consideration before wasting your time with Blacklight. Have a good day, and please excuse any mistakes as I am not a native English speaker.

reviewText:
Edit 6th April 2015: New developer announced, no changes set in stone yet. Hopefully will be seeing new content soon!

Edit 7th Nov. 2014: So according to the other review (which is currently the highest rated review) there have been no content updates in over a year. Sad really, this game was awesome. I wish it had gotten as big as something like Planetside 2. Probably wouldn't reccomend the game in it's current state. Still looking for a fps? Buy CS:GO. Awesome competitive scene, great gameplay, and it's dirt cheap too (goes down to like 4 bucks on sale). Enjoy the review if you still want to read it :P

Before I get into it I'll just note I have around 250 hrs on BLR (not 80ish), since I played it before it came onto steam.

Blacklight Retribution (BLR) is a very unique Free to Play (F2P) First Person Shooter. It has some unique mechanics that make it a different experience to games like Call of Duty or other F2P games like Crossfire and Soldier Front 2. I believe that Blacklight Retribution is the BEST F2P FPS currently on the market, but that doesn't mean that it has certain things that hold it back. I'll to a little Pros and Cons list of the game for easy comparison:

Pros:
-BLR has extremely fun gameplay and even though it has its own unique mechanics with the Depots on the maps and of course the HRV (legalised wallhack) that every player has it is very easy for the new player to pick up and learn.
-Although the term 'Legalised Wallhack' might seem a little off-putting for a lot of new players, the game is actually balanced very well, not only in terms of the HRV, but all weapons and armour also.
-Australian servers :)
-NOT PAY TO WIN. Don't listen to people who say this game is pay to win. IT ISN'T. You can get Real-Money currency and use it to bypass the level lock on items, but these same items are available to players for a reasonable amount of in-game currency once they reach the required level. Now, people might still have the argument of 'Higher level gear is better', but since in the previous point i stated that the whole game is balanced, then it doesn't really matter. :)
-GP (currency made by playing matches and getting daily achievements, etc) is made very quickly and therefore permanently buying weapons, attachments and gear is quite fast. This is a very important point for me because going for long periods of time in games without unlocking new gear is a big turn off :)
-BLR has a good community. People are helpful and nice, and yeah, you'll run into an ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ here and there but I don't really see too many of them.
-Dedicated lobbies for low level players. Hate being a new player and going into games with Max Rank players that have a lot of experience and are very good? Fear no more, lobbies that are set to only take characters levels 1-10 exist so that you can settle into the game and get some experience before facing the big guns :P
-There are a whole bunch of things that I'll list briefly here that are also pros: Fun gameplay, FoV Slider (yayyy!!!), huge range of attachments and gear, a lot of build possibilities - make your character truly unique, ZEN (Real-money currency) has arguably good value for what you get with it.

Cons:
-LACK OF CONTENT UPDATES. Wow, this is such a big problem. Because of real-life things going on for me this year I didn't end up playing BLR for 3-4 months straight. When I finally jumped on the game recently I was expecting a big patch... NOPE. Nothing. You look at games like PlanetSide 2, which I had the same situation with and there was a frikkin 9gb patch for PS2. 9gb is a bit ridiculous to me but you know... at least the game is actually getting new content...

I know there are more cons to this game but I can't think of them right now... sorry :P

Well I hope this review helped, I am not sure if you can edit these reviews after posting them. If you can, I might update the cons section once I remember some things about the game :)

See you on the battlefield :)

reviewText:
If you're an old time Blacklight player, that for one reason or another stopped playing, like me and now thought - hey, it would be fun to play BR again - DON'T! Just remember the game for how fun it was and don't look at what it turned into now.
The Parity patch, meant to reinvigorate the game, changed a lot of things - and not to a positive side. Seems like new dev team didn't really get why some things were there in the first place. Unlimited stamina bar straight up breaks one of the game's balance points between speed and toughness. The biggest thing are the weapons. They've reworked recoil system, so now it's barely in the game - sniping from across a full map like Evac with a sub-machine gun with x6 scope is a totally viable strategy now. My favorite weapon, my hand-crafted child of a machine gun feels like a stranger to me now.
Remade design of the menu is just obnoxious, and less functional (though looks more in the moders fashion of large icons, like it's on a tablet or something) and just gets in the way. And the premade weapons are gone, so you can't easily try some of the new ideas, though you can rent parts for just a day again.
And with all that, the game is less populated than I've ever seen it, the only game mode you can reliably play is TD and sometimes DOM and SD. But in that small group the community is barely existing. All the awesome people I use to know by nicknames in Blacklight are gone. And those who came don't even talk  to you, or make one lame joke as they win.
tl; dr - Blacklight: Retribution you knew is gone. This is just a mediocre game, that feels like COD with BR's name on it.
Even my old clan didn't exist anymore.

reviewText:
Congrats, you've taken the testicles of a game that consumed nearly 500 hours of my life, and you've sawed them off with a dull, rusty, decrepit saw. Then you took those beautiful testicles, that gave me so many hours of enjoyment, and you've thrown them into a wood chipper. Whatever came out the other end, you've swept/mopped up and ran it through the wood chipper again. Now I'm left with this sterilized, characterless, blank excuse of a corpse of a game, that tries so hard to pretend that it still has its balls, but in the back of its mind, and in its player's minds, knows that its balls are nothing more than a vapor in the wind, alive only in our collective memory.

rip in pepperoni and spaghetti, never forghetti, Blacklight: Retribution's testicles. May you ride eternal in the battlefields of Valhalla

Some people asked me to actually tell them what I hate about the game now, so here goes:

I posted this review around the same time that the developers of this game updated it with a parity patch that paired the PC version with the PS4 version. Everyone expected it to change the game for the better, but instead, it completely overhauled it so that it was basically a console game, with smoothed textures, controls not optimized for PC, hackers running wild with no control, and no premium servers (Premium servers were the reason why almost everyone played the game. In a premium server, someone monthly rents a server that they get to change the stats of. Basically, you could make a server pistol only, one shot one kill, unlimited stamina, headshot only, etc. Anyone could play on these servers for free, and some servers were really awesome. Like unlimited stamina, sniper rifle only, headshot only..). In normal servers, everyone had too much health, were limited by stamina, if a hacker entered the server, no admin could kick him (something you could do in a premium server), and you were forced to use the in game HRV, which is an ability that you get to use that allows you to see through walls. You couldn't possibly sneak up on somebody, or surprise them around a tight corner. This was also a main reason why people played premium servers, because you could disable HRV.

Now we're forced to use these in game wallhacks, have limited stamina, play with hackers constantly, and NO SNIPER RIFLE ONLY SERVERS, WHICH IS WHY EVERYONE I KNEW PLAYED THE GAME. Oh yeah, and before the update, if you bought an attachment for your weapon, it was unlocked for all of your weapons. Now, you have to buy that attachment for each of your weapons individually. This makes getting the same attachment for all of your weapons SUPER difficult, and very time consuming. The way out of working very hard for the things you want is to pay real money.. So yeah, they also made the game into a pay to win.

In short

Pros:

I can't think of any


Cons:

Forced to use HRV

Now it's pay to win

No customizable servers, the reason why everyone played the game

PS4 graphics, and unoptimized for PC interface and controls




Just buy Call of Duty Black Ops II. It's almost the same game, but better in every aspect. (Not as good as the old, pre-update Blacklight Retribution that I loved so much, but it's pretty dang close to it).

reviewText:
Best F2P game I have played to date.

Graphics are top notch, even better than in some AAA-titles.
Customizing your guns with lots of different parts and finding out the combination which suits you best is great fun. Of course if you are impatient you better pay some money for some items you really want. In fact I put quite a lot of money into this game because I believe the developers deserve it.

Already played 250+ hours and still loving it.

90/100

reviewText:
I have quite a lot of hours in this game, and I seen a lot of changes and additions, as well as drama.

History
the Blacklight series was a game developed by Zombie Studios, Blacklight: Tango Down was a fairly decent game. Blacklight:Retribution was better in every regard, adding a beautiful true arcadic feel to it. Many loved the game because of this, and so did I.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Positives
It's extremely easy to grasp. Press V whenever you feel paranoid or lost, and then point and shoot. Simple, easy, and fun.



-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Negatives
But honestly, that's all positivity that I can say about this game. Around a year and a half ago Zombie Studios added poor  update after poor update, adding insanely overpowered gear and creating a Metagame (Which destroyed customisation, the thing which the game was praised for).

Whenever there was poor balancing, ZOMBIE studios pointed the finger at PWE and basically said that it was all their fault. A few months later, Zombie goes bankrupt (Thank god), and the game was left to rot in it's ugly state for a long while.

The servers began to literally rot, the Australian Servers completely crashing beyond repair. It was pretty much playing a Game verison of a Ghost-Town. A bunch of brilliant ideas that were ruined by poor game design and choices by immature developers who did not take their game seriously in anyway shape or form.

This is when the game basically died.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Revival
A few developers and some community members forged a new Team called Hardsuit Labs, and they immediately began work on refining the game.

They did a decent job, I've gotta admit. They changed almost everything, sounds, movement, gun-play, melee, grenades, depots, ammo, options, customisation, EVERYTHING. Everything except for the poor balancing.

There's still insanely overpowered weapons such as the LMG, which has zero recoil and high damage across a seemingly infinite range. There's plenty of weapons and accessories which can insta-kill you.

Hardsuit Labs also did a very bad move which wasn't well received from the majority of their fanbase. They decided to completely get rid of the Australian Servers, booting away a few hundred players because their connections just can't handle the distance of playing on the other-side of the world.

I'm not sure if they said anything about this, and even then, they will say it is a PWE issue.

That brings me to the big booboo.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The Customer Service
Customer Service is an actually really easy thing to master and help out with. After the large update done to BLR by Harduit Labs, a few accounts got completely destroyed. My Main account got wiped off of the world-wide servers, it's gone completely. And I spent around 100 dollars because I couldn't be bothered grinding for XP.

My secondary account had a lot of missing items, and it was a F2P account except for Camoes and Emblems which don't affect gameplay in any way aside from appearance. At first I emailed PWE, they told me they will check into it. They then sent me off to Hardsuit Labs, providing an email address for support.

The following email I got from Hardsuit Labs was basically saying that since the damage has already been done, they don't see much point in repairing it when they have other things to do. This was in response to my missing comestics on my F2P: 4444

I thought that was reasonable, it wasn't too big of a deal, so I gave them a few months. 4 to be exact... And no update, no word from them. I sent email after email to them, resulting in complete silence.

And so I've come to the conclusion... What did the massive update change about the game and it's developers?
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Answer
Sound.

Sound as in their quality is Sound, basic.

But also Sound as in these new devs are a lot more public about things, compared to Zombie which were like toddlers.

As for Sound about the game, the Sound-Design. Wowie, the Sounds in this game are amazing. Guns feel and sound like they are futuristic and powerful, which they mostly are.


I apologise if this is a poor review, but my experiences with this game have been poor.

reviewText:
EDIT: 10/12/2015
As a Free-To-Play Game, Consider the review date and the edits to ensure that you are not led with misinformation.

STORYBlacklight Retribution is a sequel off of Blacklight: Tango Down where the setting is set a few decades into the future, where the Blacklight team comprised of the elite of the elite in the U.S. Military descend into Balik, a downtrodden desolate city filled with unknown anomalies to rescue their military commander, until they find out what has happened to this and possibly other unknown cities.

GRAPHICS/AESTHETICSBlacklight Retribution features an decent number of options to choose from. There's no overall setting to change all of them, but the game supports up to 1080p and will allow for multiple monitor support. VSync, Dynamic Shadows, Static/Dynamic Decals, Dynamic Lighting, Post-Processing MLAA, Depth of Field, and DX11 Tessellation are just some of the many options you can choose from when coming into the game.

If you have a potato computer build set with you, Blacklight Retribution will be able to accommodate. Now, that said.. I will not be able to guarantee a budget/travelling laptop build to play the game, but given that you know what the INI values should be, you can edit the game's files to be even worse than the proposed amount from the game.
**
As far as Aesthetics go, a lot of the maps seem to have been based on the desolate ruins that became of Balik. The maps range from improverished barren in small villages to commercial intersections in the city, to massive military bases with mechanical death machines. In contrast to the abstract design of the cars in town, the police vehicles give off a lasting impression of what became of this place.

The sounds between interacting with your gun, moving around, and dancing on your enemy's dead body is one of the more satisfactory parts of the game in my opinion. Regardless of the gun that you have, each one of them sounds powerful with an open muzzle. Some of them silenced do give off that pew pew feel, but it can easily be justified when carrying a weapon almost the same length as your character model's height.

GAMEPLAY90% OF THE GAME'S CONTENT IS BASED ON CUSTOMIZING YOUR WEAPON AND YOUR CHARACTER. It's definitely worth a try customizing some things, because you won't know what awesome new build you can create. I myself can tell you this reliably as most of my YouTube videos consist of making random builds and trying them out. If on the off chance however you're not up to customizing weapons and you just want to jump into the game, that is perfectly fine too.

WEAPON & CHARACTER STATS ACTUALLY MATTER. If you have played a game like Alliance of Valiant Arms or Call of Duty where attachments don't exactly give you an edge in the game, this is NOT one of those games. Some attachments may seem miniscule in changes like recoil, but they definitely affect the end result. I can equip myself a Combat Rifle with Incendiary Rounds and an Infrared Scope that behaves like a Battle Rifle in the game.

HITBOX CHANGES WITH YOUR HEALTH BUILD. Yes, Your health build depends on that hitbox. If that didn't stop you, there are taunts, titles, and numerous voices you can choose your character to have. For what they plan to add on, the combinations you can achieve through this game is truly unsurpassable. If you're the leader at the end of your game, you can do a frickin' Pelvic Thrust just to spite your enemies!

90% OF YOUR DEATHS ARE FROM LEGIT WALLHAX. I don't think I need to explain the Temporary Wallhex" that the rest of these reviewers may have done
date: but they all know that despite being a "Game-breaking" item
recommended: it definitely accounts to pretty much 90% of all the deaths we have
hoursPlayed: aside from sheer derping. If you're still wondering whether the game is actually fun

reviewText:
Update #2: Game is still ♥♥♥♥. Nothing was fixed. It was all lies. The devs are POS's who should be shut down for all the crap they tried pulling with this parity patch. And the constant lie being spread by a dev in the forums how 'just a few vets are unhappy but we can't please everyone' is total BS. ALMOST ALL VETS ARE UNHAPPY YOU TWITS. Game balance was almost 100% proper pre-parity, but even now months after they promised fixes and released a few patches the balanced is ruined. Tox-SMG sniping still wins the day, aiming for the legs nets more kills than aiming for the head. And the new netcode is taken straight from the book of how not to code an online FPS, still, months after release. We had tighter hitboxes and latency before. HSL is cashing in on you, do not let it happen due to nostaligia because the Blacklight:R that we all loved is 100% dead and deleted from existence.

Update #1: Second patch hit to fix all the problems made from parity patch. Guess what, still SMG tox snipers. Still 200dmg BAR's. HAR is weaker than ever, higher ROF guns are buffed massively in comparison to pre-parity balance. I gave up. HSL had a second chance and completely dropped it. All they did was fix it so you can actually select which server to join via mouse and added back recoil, but there is no balance to the weapons in this game. Netcode is also still terrible, shots not connecting just going through a person sitting still and making a bullet hole in the wall behind with the target untouched. Just too much. Instead of deleting the PC version of BL:R and replacing it with the PS4 version HSL would have been better served just taking BL:R off the market, what we have now is a complete sham. And idiots are still blowing the HSL devs in the forums saying good job when everyone in server agrees 9 to 1 that this game is worse than pre-parity.

Original Review:
Parity updated deleted the PC version of the game and they uploaded the much worse PS4 version in it's place. Many things are broken and people want to give the devs a chance. I've played since beta for hundreds of hours outside of Steam and loved the prior PC version, we just wanted the new items and maps on our game. Nope, Zombie Studios dissolved, some of the same team members made HSL and copy-pasted their crappy console version of the game onto PC. It's not even a good attempt at a console port, the GUI is broken in several ways. Bugs abound, had an enemy hardsuit glitch into a wall and unable to take damage, but this happened after it lag-warped everywhere. Lag is worse in this version or at least the lag compensation is worse. Many things do not work as intended like the glitchy server browser still choosing server top of list no matter which one you click. They also increased the F2P grind by now not unlocking parts for all guns, but instead making you unlock the same part for each of the 17 type of guns individually costing much more overall. There has been a price drop but it's still more than 3x the cost of the original system of buying a part and using it on all receivers. But the new level requirements help prevent people from trying new parts and equipment, it's just insane. Even as a 'Prime Member' which costs $5 to new players you have to be such a high level to unlock some things like the riot shield that it's just insane, even old level 50 players will take a while to reach the new higher levels. Most of the time I'd give the devs a chance to fix this, but these are most of the same old devs formed into a new studio and they are still working with PWE so because of PWE don't expect much without having to pay in some way.

So far it appears to be a fresh cash grab at the expense of the community, a few minor improvements were done but it's still nothing close to how good the original was. Do not get me wrong, the original had a few problems but they could have been fixed with much less effort than the giant wall of problems we have now. Some people are jumping to the defense of the devs but they mostly seem like people new to the game. I have not chatted with an older player yet in-game that says this is an improvement, and I've played a good share a matches in this new version. Forums are overall hostile, official forums lock down threads of disapproval in a Chucklefish/Phil Fish style manner but the dev on the Steam forums seems more concerned about the community. But the actions taken so far by the move overall, we will see how things play out in a few months. Will update accordingly.

reviewText:
I am aware I'm going to get hate for this but oh well.
After playing Blacklight:Retribution from it's Open-Beta until now on and off, I have to say that the game it once was, it is no longer. If I wrote this review a year ago I would have said it was the best F2P shooter on Steam, because at one point it honestly was! It looked beautiful, had a sleek, digital UI and HUD with a nice team of devs. Items were pretty balanced and it wasn't pay-to-win, with money only letting you buy weapons that you can earn instantly anyways, similar to League of Legends with RP-vs-IP on champions, for those of you who are familiar with League.

Now? The original studio was closed down/bought out and replaced with a new one that, in an effort to move it to the PS4 and be 'modern' (I think?), has ruined the once-great game.
The weapons seem very imbalanced now, you are forced to have an account with their new system and log-in to play with that instead, and worst of all, the unique and sci-fi inspired UI that garnered a lot of love has been replaced with an abyssmally disgusting and now fairly confusing pseudo-UI that looks more akin to an iPhone game or a novice Lua coder's attempt to make a custom HUD for a GMod gamemode.

I am saddened to say that after 3 years of playing this game on and off, I no longer recommend it.

reviewText:
This is absolute ♥♥♥♥... now. It used to be decent.

If you want to know how it was before, imagine an F2P CoD done right - or at least more or less right, and put into a sci-fi setting, plus some more in the way of choice added to make it less bland.

Now,  it's just ♥♥♥♥.

Let's start with the GUI and HUD. It used to change depending on your monitor, it is now fixed in 16:9 (everything looks weirdly centered on a 5:4 monitor). The GUI itself has obviously been designed for a controller, is hard and slow to navigate and just overall ♥♥♥♥ing awful. It's laid out in a way that is both confusing and hard to read, and even if one can get used to this after a while... the player list (also known as that thing what happens when you press the TAB key) doesn't show the player's ping towards the server (host?). This brings us straight to the netcode, which seems to have gotten worse. What was previously  bearable has now become so bad I lack the words to describe it.

The weapons, which previously were a very CoD4-like affair, with at least some recoil and decent sounds to make playing the game fun, are now about NERF-gun level. Not in terms of damage, but in terms of how they sound (NERF guns) and how much recoil they have (none). When getting hit by a weapon, when previously you could at least tell you were getting hit, you know cannot. In any way, really. You just die, and that's all the warning you get. And when you do die, the time to respawn has also gotten significantly longer, now being at 10s to the previous 6s (if I'm recalling that correctly, anyway).

Now, they did one good thing, and it is literally the only thing they did well in this latest big update: they finally started allowing players to rent weapons for a day for a small amount of gold points (the earned in-game currency). However, they had taken it out before for no good reason, so they don't really deserve any praise for that.

In short, this game is boring as ♥♥♥♥, will annoy you with it's menus and HUD, and then put the last nail in it's coffin by presenting you with some of the most awful gunplay I have ever seen.

reviewText:
Blacklight Retribution is possibly one of the best futuristic Free-to-Play shooters you can find in Steam. The gameplay along with the content presented in this game will have you at the edge of your seat as you engage in combat along with various players from across the world (and bots sometimes) in several large maps for you to bludgeon, snipe, dismember and kill.

The content is pretty vast in Blacklight Retribution. You have various heroes to choose from, but as a new player, you simply start with a custom hero to play. Additional heroes have significant pros and cons and they require Game Points or ZENs (a.k.a spend real money for ZEN, the in-game money). The same goes to the weapons, as you start out with a pretty formidable weapon, the Assault Rifle. While you can customize your weapons (which will incur more Game Points or ZENs), you can spend less by buying premade weapons (the only con is that you can't customize premade weapons). While depot loadouts for new users are simply enough to get by, players with enough Game Points or ZEN can purchase better depot loadouts to increase their chance of killing other players. Because acquiring certain elements in this game requires you to be in a specific level and having enough Game Points (which, I swear to Haruhi-ism, you can't get enough Game Points for every single thing you want to buy in Blacklight) means that you are forced to screw your wallet to get the stuff you need. Oh, and did I mention the DLCs in Steam are cheaper than buying seperate in the Blacklight Store? Seriously. I spent $100 on this game so far just to get the stuff I want. You're better off buying the DLCs from Steam, and even that isn't cheap to begin with. And they don't offer much. The upside to this game is that they now offer Weekly Specials, where they let free users try a specific weapon for a week and decrease the price of said weapon to about half or more, and they change the Weekly Special weapons every week. This also applies to heroes as well, so free gamers can still enjoy at least some premium items for free.

The gameplay, to be honest, is like playing Battlefield 2142 with Battlefield 3 graphics. It's simply addicting, stunning and... oh it just feels great to play this game. The map choices aren't bad. Some are big, some are small, some are just plain offensive (especially HeloDeck, where you are likely to get spawn-camped and killed). Overall, the graphics and the gameplay make up for the its' Pay-To-Win element (which is disgusting, and it might disgust gamers out there who despise Pay-To-Win games).

What do I have a say in this game? If you don't care about getting the weapons, the heroes and the loadouts to get the upperhand and if you're skillful enough, this game will please you with its gameplay and graphics. However, if you're not a fan of Pay-To-Win games, be warned as this game will do whatever it takes to screw your wallet clean.

reviewText: Blacklight is one of those games where you are not sure what you are getting yourself into. But once you are in, you do get enjoyment out of it. But more importantly its the people you meet there aswell. Sad to see it dwindling away like a fading star, although there is still die hard followers of the game that won't stop playing it ever. The shooting game play is very fast paced. For best results to win in team matches, working as a team is important. The starting default gear isn't too bad, weapons included, i have known to deal quite some damage with default gear. There are different game modes in this game but out of all of them melee was my favorite. Not suitable for starting players but very fast paced and action packed to where the real key to this mode is in skill and not the gear. I have to say that  Blacklight was one my all time favorite free fps games that i have come across in a while. Mostly because of the people i met there. If you choose to play this game, play to meet other individuals, play to have fun. You may need to grind it out for the gear you may want, thats how I did it mostly. Above all,  treat players with respect and you will earn their's.

reviewText:
Blacklight Retribution is a F2P FPS game. This game should be the standart of how FPS game are made: highly customizable weapons, heaps of armor customization that suits your playstyle, graphic that could blow your mind, unique gamemode and map that are interesting in both design and actual gameplay.

The BLR community is one of those helpful and supportive type while also competitive in-game. You can look around on YouTube or the PWE forum to get help on building equipment setup that suits your playstyle. In-game lots of the people are fun to chat with and they are also great at battle. Rest assured that 81% of the players are PTFO-type while the rest is lolly-gagin :v

This game, while has the status of F2P (free-to-play) I can assure you that you can play this game and become good (read: addicted) at it without even spending a penny. You can just keep playing and earns GP and save them up to buy perma attachments/parts that you like. BLR is one of dem PWE games that doens't really milks yur money unlike som PWE game i know.

8.7/10 from me. I would rate it higher if they would update the game more frequently. Even on its current state, the game is already fun but I still wish for more frequent update xD

reviewText: The new devs has completely ♥♥♥♥ed the game. Yes they brought in many new players, made the community so much more alive, adding new maps and also improving the UI and the AI bots. But, they removed some of the most crucial mechanics of the game that made blacklight such a competitive shooter in the first place. Gun stats do not even matter anymore! They completely ruined all the precise recoil and spread stats, making the game EXTREMELY easy to play now. All the weapons are not balance and some being way too overpowered without the recoil or spread to compensate for the high damage values. It took the devs more than a year just to bring everything from the ps4 version to the pc (It was the only update in around a year and a half to two). That is what made the game so difficult to master in the first place. Before this, it actually took skills to excell at the game and every kill felt well earned. Players had to recognize the recoil pattern which is completely different on every weapon and also consider the hip and aim spread while firing. Adding on, being the game was released three years back, it still does not provide dedicated servers in the asian region even though a good fraction of the fan base are of the asian region.

reviewText:
Before I begin I'd like to point out that I have around 500 hours on this game besides Steam.
Returning to this game after 2 years felt surprisingly nice.
I read all the reviews believing this game was dead but I decided to give it a shot anyway.

After installing the game I spent 6 hours playing and having tons of fun along the way.
The supposed dead" community was actually a bunch of cool people that I met while playing.

Let's talk pay to win and imbalance.
The game is by far not pay to win
date: in fact I probably do better with the default assault rifle than any of the other ones I own.\nThe new recoil is something people have an issue with
recommended:
tons of complaints about how all of the guns have no recoil which isn't true at all. People that say this are usually the people that use short range guns and spray hoping they can run off with a kill. I personally noticed a big difference in medium range accuracy when using different builds.

Armor
You can really build your armor any way you want.
A speed demon build to try and dodge bullets
hoursPlayed:
a tank build to trade better with enemies or maybe a medium build consisting of both speed and health. Anything works.

Gear
For gear you have little choice when it comes to actual useful gear.
You start off with a knife and a frag grenade. The knife is useless and you only get 1 grenade.
You can fix this by buying a better melee weapon
voteText:
some better grenades or even buy resistance items which reduce the damage you take by certain ammo types.

Hardsuits?
A big part of the game are hardsuits
helpfulPercent:
big mech suits that take tons of damage and go on massive killing sprees.
I'm joking. Hardsuits are almost completely useless if you know how to properly kill one. Even a default flamethrower can prove lethal to a hardsuit if you can get behind it. There is no good reason to buy hardsuits except if the entire enemy team consists of beginners.

Conclusion
The game is still very enjoyable
votesHelpful: the servers aren't empty like everyone claims and the community is actually really nice.\nIf you're starting out and don't know what the hell you're doing
votesTotal: just ask someone in chat. There will occasionally be someone poking fun at you for being inexperienced but I can assure you that the experienced players will gladly help.\n\nNow you can take a deep breath
votesFunny: stop staring at steam reviews and give the game a shot yourself."

reviewText:
About a year ago this game was absolutely near perfect. As it stands now? I can not for the life of me recommend it, Here is why.
1 The hit registry about a year ago was really good you pointed at their head & it actually hit their head, The hit registry was almost always spot on.

1 Hit registry as it stands today? Hit marker after hit marker after hit marker.... Your shots are no longer spot on & half the time they don't even register on the enemies side.

2 Connection issues about a year ago was really good most of the players you played with maybe had at the most a 90ms ping, Connection all around was pretty balanced you didn't have many issues with players being a few seconds ahead in terms of connection & you didn't have that many people from other countries trying to play wioth americans.

2 Connection issues as it stands today? Serious lag compensation all around, Players joining from russia connecting to american servers lagging the living crap out of other players giving the non american players the advantage. The average ping now in days for player matches is around 150ms.

3 Recoil about a year ago Was really good there wasn't to much recoil, But there was also just enough recoil to prevent weapons from being over powered. There wasn't really any sway on the sniper rifles either it was pretty well balanced if you knew how to customize your rifle properly.

3 Recoil about as it is today? Recoil shot way up rifles now sway way to much back & forth even when you burst fire the recoil is just crazy. The sniper rifles now have to Hold their breath to steady" the rifle which is absolutely dumb. Even if you customize your rifle properly your sniper rifle still sways like crazy & has a hell of a lot of recoil.

Final point I'll make
date: After this game started supporting consoles the PC side kinda lost its support the developers have practically left us PC gamers in the dust. After they began supporting the PS4 the game started have more & more issues with connection & cheaters. The game just isn't the same anymore & I find it sad how the developers have just left their PC side in the dust."

reviewText:
Too make things short, you are looking at a good game which was patched into oblivion.

It took 2-3 years to make this parity patch and the game is garbage now.
Recoil is non-exsistent in this game. Of course there was recoil in the older versions, but appearently no one cared to adjust the recoil stats and just pasted the console stats into the PC version.
Network is still an issue, like lossing connection to servers, higher pings than usual, or servers which simply don't work.
Economy is now worse than before. If you bought a weapon mod, you could use it on any gun, as long as you could use it on that gun. Now you have to buy every single gun mod for every single gun seperate.
Performance got better, which is at least one plus since the patch.
Game is still not P2W, which is also nice.

If you are looking for a fun, good f2p shooter you are 3 years too late, search somewhere else, since I doubt these issues are getting fixed soon.

reviewText: The game itself is pretty fun, the artstyle and cyberpunk feel is amazing, however the Free to Play model they use is about as bad as it can get. You can customize anything for cheap...as long as you're willing to shell out more credits to renew the rent, each item can either be rented or permanently owned however the price scaling is ludicrous. The price scaling runs about like this, 1 Weapon Accessory that costs about 395 GP (InGame Earned Currency) to rent, usually the rent scale is 3 days to 7 days, however to own it permanently, it's going to cost you about 3750 GP for ONE accessory, to put this in perspective you earn ABOUT ~200 GP per match (Start to End), that means you're going to be playing about 19 matches just to get one. single. item. Alternatively you can pay Zen which is obviously the cash-currency of the game and to give you an idea of the cost of items through actual money, $10 nets you 1000 Zen, to get that previously mentioned weapon accessory it'll cost you 300 Zen or $3 for 1 single accessory. This game would be amazing if it provided players with more options to customize their character without having to spend actual money. If you're looking for another Sci-Fi F2P game, I'd recommend Warframe instead

reviewText:
Whelp, time to pass judgement after the recent patch that at least fixed something bout gameplay: team balance. Finally, HSL removed the blacklight prime, a license that allowed only the ppl that had to pay $5 upfront before he/she could buy any ingame items using gp (ingame currency that u got from playing)
Before that, the parity patch was pretty trashy-all we got as beta players were cosmetics (nice hat without stats) , a title and blacklight prime. Since newbies couldn't buy items to protect themselves from toxic ammo without paying in real cash, all the veterans (vets) had to do was join the team with most vets and they would almost certainly win if they used toxic ammo and explosives the new guys nvr could get their hands on. Toxic ammo does little direct dmg but can continue to down whittle ur health even after the bullets stop hitting u and also, it reduces ur max health so u couldn't heal back to full health even with the supply depot. Heal injectors could help to prevent one from dying but unfortunately, its a gp item.

Plus, the level restriction prevented players from getting the guns or gear they wanted unless they've been playing for quite a while.

After the christmas patch however There was no team balance either, not before and not now. Apparently there is a system to arrange for players to be in differing teams depending on their stats (to pit the vets against themselves and so on) but if the teams were even numbered, there is nothing to prevent the players from switching teams.
Still no spawn protection as before. U could spawn into a mob of enemies or proximity mines (as usual).

As for the mechanics:
What  BLR promotes as gameplay is rather infuriating, camping and gangbanging. There is no mechanics to promote fighting as individuals. Going as a team is good, switching players to take frontline dmg helps as health regen will help to heal u back to half health and the moment u get a kill, u can recover to max health at a supply depot. However, there is no piercing ammo to counter this.
Customisation is fixed before starting a round, if u wanted to change primaries, u would need a diffenrent customised slot for 10k gp as well as the weapon itself. The problem being, u couldn't change gear that way. If ur armor or is too slow or has too low hp for the playstyle that suits u, u would only have 30s to customise before the next round. There's no preset armor build to accompany the weapon sets. 1 armor set would be used for an entire match even if u change wep sets.

Variety is lacking ever since the parity patch kicked in. No longer are the weapon tags (which boost stats by a little) free. No shock, no explosive nor magnum ammo. The only missions you get now are daily kills, daily wins and weekly dmg dealt (apart from headshot kills for the title). The only free skin for looking good is the daylight skin. U can no longer get the golden skin from the headshot kills achievement. U could no longer purchase the fox + cat helm and leveling only awards u with titles (at lvl 30 and above). If anything, I wished COD had the hrv (x-ray vision) and not this game. At least COD doesn't crash every few days, has ppl playing and has less absurd features like chat censorship.  Or frequent crashing. Still looking for the day where I'll change this review to a good one but if u were me, u'll get impatient too after a few yrs.

reviewText:
Here's a positive review, just so you can finally hear about the game, and not hear the endless fits about the patch.

First thing's first, you're mostly likely going to get destroyed in multiplayer. Please restrain from blaming it on people's superior gear. The weird thing about that, is that you're wrong AND right to blame the gear. The truth is, the starter gear is bad purely because of the fact it doesn't focus on anything. You're not as a disadvantage with your gear, you just don't have any clear advantage. The point of this game is to allow you to customize your armor and guns to what you want, and customizing it how you want hurts other stats.

Onto the game itself.
From the customization, to the music, to the general theme, BL:R is a truly unique game. It's a solid fast paced FPS, that has plenty of things that separate it from others. Everyone can wallhack, everyone has sweet looking helmets, and everyone is slightly different in some way due to the customization.

First impressions can be harsh, but just try your best to rent everything you want, and make the money back by using it. You will quickly find something that'll make you want to play more. And once you find that, you should have no trouble gaining the in game currency to buy permanent stuff. Blacklight without a doubt feels like just another low budget F2P game, but it had a lot of heart put into it. It's tons of fun if you just have the right mindset.

This is one of my favorite games, and debatably my favorite shooter. The patch was rough yes, but the new devs are working to fix the things they've broken. In the end, the things people are complaining about are meaningless. They're big deals in one way or another, but that shouldn't stop people from enjoying what it has to offer. My game runs fine, I shoot people in the same way I always have, I enjoy the new maps, and customize my stuff the way I always have. They also recently added a permanent double GP booster. Given for free for previously existing accounts. But you can always buy it, though it isn't necessary.

Take my review however you want, I just figured the review section could finally use some kind words.

reviewText:
First of all, The Parity Patch as mostly ruined a game that once was fun to play with your friends. I'd enjoy to pay a few bucks to host my own premium server, play with friends and bots; having fun whilst doing so. But no.. They decided to remove the premium servers and add private match on this instead. Private match ain't even working for me and my friends.
Now it is time for pros and cons:

Pro's:
+ You don't literally need to empty your clip on a single enemy during an online game. Which makes burst fire rifle effective.
+ Snipers are still one shot kill weapons with correct build.

Con's:

- Removal of e-mail system: This was one of the most ♥♥♥♥♥iest things to do. I liked to send guns and tokens to my friends. But because of this, I don't know a damn way to do so.

- Removal of custom premium match: Seriously, what was more fun than having an admin rights on your own or on your friend's server, and having bots to play with when there wasn't enough players in your server.

- The guns have no recoil whatsoever: Nice, I do like to shoot a sniper at 1 kilometer distance. Thanks to this parity patch, I can make my dream come true! Seriously. One of the WORST things to do was removing the recoil of majority of guns.

- Parity patch gave us PC players the PS4 version instead of updating and patching the game that wasn't as broken and ♥♥♥♥ed up as this one! Yes, I am talking about the real old BLR before this parity nonsense.

- The fact that you still have to grind a few thousand matches for a single gun and a few attachments.

Overall rating: 4/10, most of the things ♥♥♥♥ed up a game that was amazing free to play game once.
Bring back the old Blacklight, Hardsuit Labs!

reviewText: This game used to be the best I have 1200+ hours on it and I spent close to 100 dollars on it.. I now regret spending a dime. There came a time when the original developers (Zombie Studios) literally neglected the game and just stopped caring for it. Dont get me wrong the Publishers (PWE) are at fault aswell. The game got stale and boring. I learned every corner of the map and knew everything to heart. It came to the point where I could guess what my oponents' weapons' stats (which actually was a nice advantage) because I knew everything! A game should not be neglected that much to the point where you could even guess the stats of weapons that aren't even your own! It was fun back in the day but after this recent update (which actually RUINED the game) I was fed up. Everything about the game even the older maps made me so angry about how the game ended up. I loved this game and to see the game slowly dying because the developers (and publishers) don't know how update the game without actually changing and taking the little things that made this game unique. Now this game is utter garbage and might as well get taken off the steam store considering they have something called arc, they simply dont need steam anymore. If I could get my money back I would and go spend it on a more deserving game but I can't. What's done is done and I probably wont ever install it again unless I'm sure there are people working on it who actually care and aren't lazy ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s. Time to take my angry wallet, computer space, and broken heart elsewhere.

My experience with this game:

>Download from Steam
>Launch game
>Wait until the launcher finishes patching the game
>Hit Play"
>Greeted with login page
>Create account
>Alt+Tab
>Confirm account via email
>Alt+Tab
>Try and log in
>"Incorrect username or password"
>Ok no big deal maybe I just entered it wrong
>Type in password more carefully this time
>"Incorrect username or password"
>Oh well
date:
maybe I typed it in wrong during the registration
>Alt+Tab
>Open Chrome and go on the website
>Try to log in there because maybe it's just a problem with the game
>"Incorrect username or password"
>Click "Having trouble logging in"
>Reset password (have to go through 2 Captchas do so not usually a big deal but I was pretty irritated by now)
>Alt+Tab
>Try and log in
>"Incorrect username or password"
>*Sigh*
>Alt+Tab
>Reset password to something super easy to remember (hooray for more damn captchas)
>Alt+Tab
>Try and log in one more time

I want you try and guess what happened next. Just go ahead and take a guess.

>Alt+F4

reviewText:
Really engaging first person shooter, with good graphics going for it.
This one is going to please stat monkeys. The weapons are extremely customizable, with options to swap out bodies, muzzles, etc.
As far as I can tell, the microtransaction part is implemented in a fair way, earning you ingame GP to spend on stuff you want to buy. Additionally, the option to rent guns for a set amount of time, really levels out the playing field, enabling me to score top 3 spots, topping players that were 15+ levels in front.
The ability to enable time-limited X-ray vision, giving you the opportunity to localize enemies, provides for dynamic, quick paced gameplay, with little or no possiblity to camp it out. Having glanced at the beta, this appeared at first to be a possible game-breaker, but thankfully this is not the case.
This game seems extremely well thought out. It's got different loadouts, a range of auxiliry packs you can carry with you, a myriad of game modes, customizable character items, killstreak rewards, etc.
Last but not least, the ability to call in a mech that you can operate, adds to the overall enjoyment. This element had me worried as well, but turns out to be equally well balanced, as it lacks the X-ray vision, is restricted in its movements across the map and has limited movement speed, boostable for a short period of time.
As an avid, long time gamer, I have to confess this game has impressed me a lot.
I would like to end this short review by tipping my hat to the devs for creating this hugely enjoyable game, and highly recommending it to everybody looking for a original, futuristic first person shooter, that distinguishes itself from the pack.

reviewText: Where do I start? Aparatently BLR takes place in a world where recoil doesn’t exist. Devs claim to be trying to fix this, so let’s look at the change log. Want something other than the AR? Just grind six hours of gameplay or you can spend $10 and get it now. Fanboys claim this game isn’t P2W, when in reality, it is. Don’t install until this game is fixed, which, looking at the current speed it’s taking, it’ll be fixed at the same time Half-Life 3 is released.

reviewText:
Once upon a time I would have recommended BL:R without a second thought and it still stands as one of my favourite shooters, but in it's current state I cannot suggest that you play it. A technically competent shooter, with nice visuals, an awesome cyberpunk aesthetic and a pretty fair F2P model to boot - it's downfall was a developer who failed to push any meaningful content in a reasonable timespan before the playerbase by and large had moved on coupled with some poor business choices.

Presently, the studio behind the game (Zombie Studios) has disbanded, the IP has moved to a new studio Hardsuit Labs (previously Builder Box?) who has also taken on some of Zombie's staff, and the game kind of just exists in some kind of limbo supported by Perfect World Entertainment (the game's publisher). For the Aussie players like myself, the AU servers have been shut down indefinitely as well.

Perhaps we'll see some kind of resurgence under the new dev team in which case I'll change my review to reflect this but until then I feel this game is well past it's glory days and not worth picking up seriously.

reviewText:
[01-10-2015] Zombie Studios has now closed down, and all rights to the game have been transfered to the Blacklight team under the name Builder Box. These are the same people that've worked on the PlayStation 4 version and are in talks with Perfect World for what is to come. No roadmap or details have been given at this time, but many players are expecting to see the long awated and much needed improvements make their way into the game after what seemed like a year of existing in limbo.


Been playing the game one month after Closed Beta ended, and I can say it's worth playing. A number of weapon parts can be bought for Perm using GP, the in-game currency, so there really isn't any need to spend actual cash (ZEN) in the game; unless you want one of the many fancy Camos that are available, or if you want to try your luck at the Chance Packs.

reviewText:
This game has great graphics and a lot of different playing modes. I commend BLR for not falling into the 'Pay 2 Win' category with every gun I've seen so far being well balanced. I was disappointed to see the community is quite small now, but my guess is this mostly because the devs don't even update this game anymore. Given how polished it already was however, it's not as big a deal as some people make it out to be. The wide variety of gadgets and customised weapons you can obtain keep the gameplay interesting and sets it aside from other fps games. At the end of the day this game is free to play and you should definitely try it out.

[EDIT]
A few months ago now BLR changed hands to a different company. This new business decided they would completely change the game and well, I wanted to cry after I saw what they'd done.
I haven't touched this game for a long time now despite it used to being my favourite game of all time. Basically they ♥♥♥♥ed up all the gun balancing, removed maps and now it plays like a completely different fps. I'd do anything to get the old game back. Even considering asking them for the old game files and server files if they still have it so I could get a private old version of the game happening. That would be very far fetched though. Rest in peace Blacklight Retribution, you will never be forgotten.

reviewText:
I used to love Blacklight Retribution... Really, I thought it was incredible how a game so well polished and innovative for the genre could be free. - I returned now a couple of years later and tried it out to finally be able to play it full on graphics and really see this game in the best possible way. - I logged in only to discover that you have to be certain levels to even achieve new weapons. And of course the attachments too should have a level requirement. - Other than that, I quick joined to find a match, I kept on finding the same match over and over again. (I tried to switch after the game ended, due to ridicioulos team matching....) I found the same match every time, when I tried to manually join another match, well!.. I was blessed with lonelyness. Noone was in the server, and I had to quick join to join a match, which of course turned out to be the one that I already left 4 times by then.

For some reason the game have taken a turn towards the worst, not only limiting the players to grind with a dull (yet alright) weapon for so long to achieve acces to trying the sniping aspect of the game. Yet on top of that, they promote their real cash-system without level requirements, too much, pushing it into your face.

This game have been left to die.. I loved the game for what it was, and I still love the concept, but this is just sad remains of a thing that was once great, and had some dignity...

My final score for this game is 7.2/10

reviewText:
BL:R is an awesome game. Definitely worth checking out if you're into FPS games. The HRV (built in wallhack) is a brilliant twist to the game which gives it a lot more speed and a whole new set of things to worry about when you're running around on the map.

The weapons are customisable from stock to barrel and muzzle, scope to magazine size. You can trade off accuracy for an easier to control weapon, or a higher damage bullet. Or you can try and have a very accurate weapon but you have to learn the recoil patterns in order to properly control it. Your character and the armour you wear are also selectable which means that this game gives its players the ability to sacrifice HP for higher run speed or vice-versa. You can also equip a ton of different camos and paint your weapons using some of the camos provided. Lots of rare camos exist as well, they come around once a year at certain points. The trade/in game mail system no longer exists as of the parity patch" so trading is no longer an option to obtain rare things.

The cons of the game would be the microtransactions related to the camos and emotes. HOWEVER you should keep in mind that a non paying player can have everything that a paying player has except for the aesthetic parts of the game (camos
date: taunts etc.).\n\nThe game is in no way Pay To Win. Whoever says that
recommended: has no idea what they are talking about.\n\nUnfortunately the game has certain overkill weapons and items that annoy most people who are in it for the FPS experience and the challenge of defeating another good player. Some people will use the Hardsuits (which are being used as a selling point of the game which to me makes no sense
hoursPlayed: they should be taken OUT of the game) which are large mechanical suits that you can use to obliterate people in front of you. reviewText:
While not the best free to play game on the market, it is definitely one that is well worth your time and maybe a little bit of your cash. Built on Unreal Engine 3 utilizing nice DX11 effects that while making it so that the game will run on pretty much any computer at nice settings while maintaining an excellent frame rate. Gameplay is focused on powerful weapons that require skill to use by not overpowering any of the guns but having each one of them built for a different play style. A big deal with this game is the fact that there is no minimap in the game but instead you can utilize this ability given to you that allows you to see where ever enemy is in the area with heat signatures through walls but you must use this carefully because you can't shoot while you are using this and it has to recharge. The sound in this game is well done and if you have nice headphones, I am pretty sure you should be able to hear footsteps fairly well and be able to pinpoint their location from that. The playerbase in this game is still strong at the time of writing and is becoming more skilled every day. The updates for the game are strong and frequent but may take up a fair bit of your time to complete due to their size but this isn't really a surprise for an online game. Customizing your character and your gun is a lot of fun in this game and I felt it was really well done. The amount of options available for weapons is great and it isn't like they cost too much to rent a great gun. While in game cash and XP don't come as fast as it may come in other games similar to this, I felt they came at a reasonable pace that never felt truly unfair. This game has gunplay that feels like a mix of Counter Strike Source and Call Of Duty 4 which for some is a really interesting mix but this isn't for everyone. It is free so feel free to try it out if you would like.

On a side note: I was also able to try the PS4 version of this game and I can't say I recommend it in its current state. The game, for PS4, is still in beta but it has a lot of issues that it needs to fix. One big issue I had with it was the fact that the game often required too precise aim for a controller. The game still felt like it was being built for a PC. There were also some frame rate stutters from time to time that can irritate if in the middle of combat but graphically it was nice. I can't complain too much for it being a free to play game but I just really wish it was as good on PS4 as it was on PC.
I recommend this game to anyone who likes FPS games and is looking for something new.

82/100

reviewText:
Review 25/11/2014

EDIT: I've player for longer, but on the ARC client....

Short Review:

It's a great game but gets stale quickly. The game was abandoned roughly a year ago, or more but I can't remember. A huge patch would revive this game but it will probably be too little too late. Australian servers were removed a while back. Oceanic players will probably have better connections playing Blacklight Retribution Asia, or soon to come out Blacklight Retribution Russia. This game offers so much customisation possibilities and has everything to cater for different play styles. I recommend it to burn off time. If you don't like it, it's good for uninstalling.

8/10 (used to be 92/100 on steam)

Long Review:

Oh boy do I love this game. Blacklight: Retribution (BLR) is a first person shooter set in a dystopian future not too far away with a steampunk feel. There's not much storyline but it's based of its predecessor, Blacklight: Tango Down. The world was ravaged by a virus that turned people into the infected (SIVs) released by political extremists called the “Order” and the only people left to stop them are hired mercenaries (you). BLR is currently being published by Perfect World Entertainment (PWE) while content is being published by Zombie Studios. BLR PS4 is published and produced by Zombie Studios.

I started the game a while ago. I got pub stomped all day every day for the first 20 or so levels because BL:R was my second legit" PC FPS game that wasn't full of potatoes. Now as a level 50 life's easy. A lot of new players call BLR pay2win. Well
date: it's far from it. It is severely play2win in my opinion. Heck
recommended: the starter assault rifle is deemed the best weapon in the game due to its versatility BUT to fully customise it to your liking will take time and effort (a long grind). Alternatively
hoursPlayed: you can rent parts and new guns (receivers). Each time you level up a level pack is awarded to you which includes all the unlockable items for that level for 3 days. The game offers a wide variety of guns with their specific niches but the assault rifle in doubtfully the most used due to its versatility.  Yeah
voteText: all the starter stuff is pretty damn good and all you need really (almost).\n\nGameplay wise BLR
helpfulPercent: it’s pretty solid. The game features a hyper reality visor (HRV) which is basically legitimate wall hacks. For a short period of time every once in a while you can see through walls and pinpoint enemies on the map. For this reason
votesHelpful: there is no mini-map but this mechanic ensures that gameplay is always fast paced. Camping can be quite difficult in this game.  The recoil in this game is honestly not that bad and the spread is in a random cone around your cross hair. For that reason “professional” players like to use static crosshairs. Concerning the grenade throwing mechanics
votesTotal: they feel wimpy and I don’t like it but it’s probably just me. You will hate corners if you want to turn them hugging the wall because you will get stuck and die a lot. Elevators can glitch out sometimes letting you jump super high
votesFunny: off the map
commentsCount: in the map and such.\n\nThere are many maps that are small (Helodeck) to medium (Dropzone) to large (Vortex). All in all there are roughly 18 maps and 9 gamemodes. 2 gamemodes are restricted to specific maps and I’ll talk about those soon. Basically you have the traditional
column16: bread and butter gamemodes of every (most)  FPS;  death match
column17: team death match
column18: king of the hill
column19: capture the flag
column20: Search and destroy
column21: and onslaught (PvE
column23: the map Centre only). Concerning search search and destroy
column24: the bomb has hrv cloak which basically masks a person’s netwar signature from HRV. Basically they cannot be seen on HRV. The other game modes include domination
column25: netwar and siege. Domination is when you hack nodes (these box thingies) to capture them and gain points. Other teams can take/retake nodes captured by the opponents by hacking them but there is a firewall (time frame) which stops the node from being retaken after capture. netwar is a mix of capture the flag and domination. Siege is where you transport a scorpion tank through a specific path towards the enemy’s base. Players can pilot the tank which has a minigun that can tear through enemies like hot butter through a knife. There are checkpoints in which the team escorting the tank have to hack panels t lower barriers in order for the tank to proceed.\n\nIn BLR you can pretty much customised everything you want including the HUD using a third party application. You can customise your armour to suit you play style. You can be a tank or a fragile but extremely fast agent. You can customise every part of your gun and there are 23 different types of guns with their own niches. There are over 20 parts for each part of a gun you want to customise (except magazines
column26: there’s like 5-15 options). There are billions of weapon combinations possible in BLR. You can choose your specific gear such as grenades
column28: explosive resistance patches and such along with your tactical gear such as heal injectors

revive injectors and barricades.
Connections wise there are only servers located in the US East and West along with European servers. Australian servers were removed a while back. Blacklight Retribution Asia is an alternative but it has a different publisher. Lag is a major problem for all players.

Content wise

reviewText:
I advise you have your wallet ready if you want to play this game.

While many players say that you don't need to pay to do good in this game, there's still many ways to get an advantage over other players, all which involve throwing your wallet at the screen.  If you want to access a better weapon early, or perhaps a modification for said weapon, bust out your wallet, and you're set.  If you want something nice without paying, be prepared to play hours on end, just for one thing.  You can buy special taunts, too, to scream how much you payed in the enemy's face.  Wallet: Retribution can be played for free, but you'll likely have the disadvantage.

Now, onto the gamepl- *gets spawnkilled*

Bad Spawn: Retribution can annoy any player with it's terrible spawn system.  In team matches, the spawns aren't so bad, and you'll usually get a chance to leave where you spawned.  However, joining team matches is hard, because in this game, six players in a twelve player server is a full server.  In a deathmatch, or free-for-all, as you might know from other games, the spawns are about as bad as the weapon balance between everything and the submachine gun.  Bad spawn scenarios include spawning in front of somebody, spawning in front of a turret, spawning in the same place that a spawn camper" has had their sights aimed down for the past five minutes
date: and even spawning in the same line of fire that just killed you.  Bad spawns will cost you the match
recommended: and it normally does.\n\nAs for the weapons and equipment
hoursPlayed: prepare for a garbage excuse of balance.\n\nFirst things first

votesFunny: the servers.\n\nThe servers that actually have more than three people playing in them are always full
commentsCount: have a ping limit

reviewText:
Good game overall, it is one of the p2w (Pay 2 Win) games that offer a direct advantage when you have the cash for it, but you could just as well spend your time collecting money (Even though extremely boring).
The game has a thousands of possiblities concerning the gun creation, however many people tend to use the Assault Rifle since it is so easy to kill with.
I do believe that there should be more varities in power with the receivers and it's quite difficult to actually kill anything when you start playing.

One major con is that it takes rather long to get the necessary funds to build the character you want, and if you screw it up and decide that you want to buy something else, you're just going have to play non-stop until you can buy it.
There should be more events that give you high GP bonuses, because in during one week I had to play non-stop to get the stuff I want.

A major pro is that once you do receive the sufficient funds to actually build the character you want you can have lots of fun with it. At this point the game gets really interesting since the diversity in what you can kill and what can kill you is totally dependant on what kind of character you create. Or you could just create a stealth-tank character and go massacre people with it, disregarding everything else. ._. I also do love throwing grenades at people, especially HE grenades.
7.5/10

reviewText:
I don't actually play this game on Steam, rather I download it off of PWE's main site. I played it maybe...2 months or so? I haven't played in around 2 years but as I write this review I may play it again. It was really fun, despite it being systematically repetitive. It's not pay2win but it's rather grindy (then again every FPS is grindy) but in a good way, I suppose?
You essentially grind for GP and hope you win for a chance to try out the pre-mades or save up more for permanents. Graphics are awesome, Deus Ex-esque, and has a slight punk-Tron look as well. The guns sound amazing (especially the LMG, I love hearing that thing go off), the customization for weaponry is so in-depth and the stats tell you exactly what it's going to do. Not on a 1 - 10 scale or how low, medium, or high the damage is, and the original soundtrack is dubsteppy to some extent, though quite catchy.

Sadly though, we're talking about a game published by Perfect World here. These guys aren't worth the trouble of paying Zen for. They used to be a decent company, but now they just don't care about their games nor the community and have moved on to greener pastures.

Give it a whirl. It's got some decent fun into it.

reviewText: I have a level 21 or so account on the US Servers - the EU ones didn't exist when I started playing. The game is very good, with snappy fast-paced shooting that feels tight and authorative, with good game-pacing allowed by the HRV -- Essentially every player has a wallhack, and nobody is ever terribly isolated from all the action because of that.\n\nThere are no cheap a**ba*tard snipers camping in corners and waiting for a perfect headshot because anyone can spot them with the HRV. The game is good, original, and pioneering. It makes for a fun and rewarding experience, and apart from my own personal temper problems, I've very much enjoyed playing it! 8/10, would recommend!
voteText: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Gameplay: The game play is solid and customization system allows for fine tuning any play style. While there aren't a CoD ton of maps, they're unique, varied, and the game modes keep them from being droll paths.

Pay to win?: This is the most well balanced free FPS in terms of the p2w players. A first timer with 20mil ZEN still wont beat any month long player. The only items that are real money only are cosmetic, all equipment can bought with in game money or cash.

Community: From what I see on the US servers, there's a fair amount of players, but a good amount of noobs and jerks. I hear EU is a smaller but tighter community. You get out of the community what you put in. Be friendly and mature in chat and on the forums and you'll be more likely to hear of offers, events, even people giving items away! (Just never beg, like, don't be gross, k?)

Bugs: There are some. I've only run into minor ones, rarely, and they've all been 'known bugs'. Nothing worth rage quitting or title bashing over in the least.

Summary: 10/10 Would Bangbang.
