reviewText:
Blacklight: Retribution is a fast phase FPS game with a Hyper Reality Visor (HRV) that let's you see through walls to find the enemy, although you can not shoot while in HRV and it only last for a few seconds, so use it whisely.
This game also features a huge customization of guns, gun parts, armor etc.
Also while you play in a match you get CP points wich you can use in a Depot to buy some cool guns, hardsuits and turrets.
Also all of this is bought by in game money so all the guns , gun parts and armors are for free! But if you want to you can also buy them for Zcoins/Zen.
This game is similar to C.O.D bit in my opinion Blacklight: Retribution is actually better, and it's free. It has beautiful graphics and a great feeling while playing with 7.1 surround sound.

Go ahead, stop reading this and download the game to have some fun!

Also, beware there are some clans out there that have some really good players. Heres just a few of those clans: N1, Veca, KIWI, RocX

Please rate this review and I always feel free to right my English if I've wrote something wrong.

Good luck, Agent!

at the time (before the big 2015 update) this game was entertaining, but now, its pretty much a joke, and a dissapointment.

the community was.... a little unique, but that can be said for a lot of FPS games, but once you get used to them, it was pretty good. this game had a lot of stuff that needed work sure, but it was generally a fun game to play. with plenty of different types of gamemodes, maps, and custom server settings, there was pretty much a server for everyone. weither you like low health games with primary and secondaries only, or the full game with all of its equipment and wallhacking goodness.

reviewText: Another Cryptic/PWE group game but entirely different from their usual MMO bit. I think this is actually a decent FPS with some interesting mechanics, such as the battle suits and visor system. The game play is very fast paced, and unfortnately for you--the cash content is not just flash as it mostly is with their other games. My experience suggests that the top players in most rounds have dropped some cash on the game. You can still have fun, but if your ego needs the win to enjoy the game, just get used to the idea that you may need to pony up. Just be careful because PWE has some security issues, and I don't entirely trust them. I would never buy anything through them directly because of things that have happened in the past with them either not noticing a major hack or at least not notifying the public for quite some time. Just saying. Game is fun for some free diversion but not much staying power without cash--and that's really just for bragging rights and ego trips.

reviewText:
Allow me to explain my previous experiences in FPSs in a weird analogy. Call of Duty, while initially impressive, wanted too much out of the relationship and wasn't willing to change. Battlefield was better, but took up too much space in the apartment and generally didn't give much back out of the deal. But Blacklight Retribution is different. It likes me for me and dammit if I don't love it for it.

Thats enough of that dumb analogy.

Blacklight Retribution is a online only Free-To-Play FPS with startling creativity. The story goes that in the near future there is a special forces team called Blacklight (hence the name of the game) that goes around saving the day with the most high tech gear that money just wishes that it could buy. The setting for the game offers a lot of really cool possibilities for it's weapon set up and that adds a lot of appeal for me in this game. Its the only FPS that suggested to me that Shurikens with the power to taze someone was a good idea and I'll be damned if it isn't!

Speaking of the weapons, the game allows you to make your own. This is no here's and gun player

reviewText: I love this game, its one of my favorite games on my library.. The gameplay is so smooth and feels good when shooting. reviewText: Futuristic designs, cool maps, fast-paced action, lots of customization freedom, beautiful on high graphics, legit wallhacks, strafing, VOIP, interesting recoil patterns, competitive and casual community clans, not P2W in the slightest. Lots of potential for growth and popularity, especially in competitive scene. Downsides are slow content release and little communication between developers and community. Invest your time into this game if you enjoy smashing keyboards and raging so hard your (eye)balls drop on the floor. 11/10 would BLR with Jerry again. <--- Search on YouTube.

reviewText: No matter how much I tried to like this game I just simply couldn't. The community seems to be even worse that the one of CS:GO which is quite an achievement. This hermetic group take no criticism whatsoever and responds to everything they dislike with insults. The game itself looks quite bad. Textures are low res and fuzzy, gunplay is disappointing with almost no recoil and extreme accuracy even while shooting from the hip. The fact that as a new player you are starting with inferior guns and the only way to upgrade is to grind or pay real money doesn't help it either. As a fan of everything that's cyberpunk I'm deeply disappointed with this game. Having to create an account to play, having to pay $ or grind for upgrades, epic dubstep after every round, cancerous community, casual game play, all of that left me with unpleasant aftertaste and bad breath.

reviewText:
This may/ may not entirely be about the latest patches and the development in mentality and attitude coming from the community recently, i'm not gonna focus on the old patches and what used to be.

I've played this game for the best of... well too long now which I don't necessarily consider to be a bad thing, in light of the recent patches many of the people who have been playing this game for a long time have come to be disappointed in the fact that they recently changed up the game mechanics leaving a new and reformed Blacklight: Retribution. There have been quite a few bugs over the last couple of months which is to be expected of renewed development in a game which basically stood still for an extended amount of time, that said I have seen people giving the game unnecessary bad press because it isnt what they were expecting it to be after the patch.

The old version of the game worked no one can deny that but it also had its flaws, like most games do. In this case it is important to understand that even if the game may have its flaws at this given point in time, the developers aren't sitting idly by but rather spending their time working and improving the game.

Blacklight Retribution used to be a great Sci-fi FPS, some people may not realize it, but it still is. Not sure if my opinion means anything, but if you are reading this, and maybe even considering to try the game for the first time. Then look me up, because i'll still be here.

If nothing else, then thanks for taking your time to read this.

reviewText:
Amazing for a fps, phenomanal for a F2P,

Pros:
-Renting allows you to try a weapon/part cheap
-Great weapon customization (lets you change everything from the receiver to the muzzle)
-Also able to buy full guns for less
-HRV lets you see every player (wallhack) giving gameplay a tactical feel)
-Fast paced shooting due too lots of health
-Onslaught= Fast paced zombie survival for free
-Great close-future aesthetic/art style
-Quick and great UI
-Good peformance and good graphics

Cons:
-Not everything avaidable for rents or 3 day rent
-Building your own gun takes ALOT of time to get the money for
-Grenades are incrdibly hard to throw in time

Another great feature is the killstreak system rather then fourcing you to get enough kills in one life it gives you in match currency earned by capturing, kills, headshots and more. You can then go to a terminal and by everything from hardsuits (mechs) to katanas to flamethrowers. the hardsuits especially feel great because while they kill everything theirs still alot of balace as you can burn the pilot out with a flamethrower and use it yourself.

reviewText:
Tl;Dr:
Used to be good game then hit the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥. Then it got resurrected and is now the most badass FPS ever.

NEW REVIEW:
So quite a long time ago, Zombie Studios, BL:R's original creators, got paid off to deliberately do absolutely nothing with the PC port of BL:R (keep in mind, the PC is where this game started in the first place), meaning no updates, no development, nothing for the PC. Instead, they got paid to focus entirely on the PlayStation 4 port. Everyone who caught wind of this was devastated, myself included. I even remember some parts that were new being REMOVED FROM THE GAME, like the game was being deupdated
date:
influencing people to play on the inferior PS4. They even added insult to injury by making the things you could buy with ingame cash ridiculously expensive and hard to come by. What used to be a simple grab after playing one match became a monotonous quest of completing 7 matches to get a simple scope for your Assault Rifle.
Then the game went silent, and the playerbase began to drop.
THEN SUDDENLY FROM THE DARK ASHES OF THE  PAY TO WIN ABYSS COME ZOMBIE STUDIO'S VETERAN DEVELOPERS UNDER THE NEW NAME OF HARDSUIT" TO RESURRECT THIS HELL OF A GAME AND GIVE IT THE ATTENTION IT MOST CERTAINLY DESERVES!
Not only is Hardsuit adding content back into the PC port
recommended: but they're also doing something they call "Content Pairity
hoursPlayed:
which is basically another word for Cross Platform Support, meaning PC players AND PS4 players can play together. Much of the game has been reworked, gun parts rebalanced, better design, etc. While there are some things you can only buy with real cash (the Polaris helmet, for example) and some people might call it Pay to Win, I disagree; for one, these developers deserve all the cash they can get for bringing this masterpiece back, and honestly, you get what you pay for, and it's not really expensive. At this point, the game is about skill (and wallhacking), so those stat changes aren't going to change much.
If you were a veteran player and was disappointed by Zombie's decision to do what they did, your hopes and dreams have been fulfilled and the game has redeemed itself to be something absolutely amazing.
Play it...

OLD REVIEW:
This has got to be one of the greatest FPS games that I have ever played
+ Futuristic style
+ Very well designed maps
+ Customization of your player and your weapons
+ Cool game mechanic (it's wall hacking, but it's not!)
+ Nice graphics and shading
+ Some nice gamemodes
+ Guns feel smooth
+ It's free
- According to a few reviews, there are many (known) bugs that the developers can't be bothered to fix
- Developers who don't care (listed above)
- OnSlaught gamemode doesn't have much effort put into it (it may have been removed)
- Practice AI seems broken (May have been fixed.  Otherwise it's experimental)
- Pay-To-Win
- Probably a few more that I'm forgeting to mention

I would recommend this just so that you people can try it out.  Honestly, it is a very fun game (and you can customize a lot of stuff, which was a pretty big selling point for me) and I would play it some more if I had the time, but I wouldn't spend money on this (especially if the devs don't do anything useful with it).

reviewText:
Blacklight: Retribution or commonly known as BL:R is the second installment and follow-up to Blacklight: Tango Down. While Retribution is a PvP FPS, it does offer high quality graphics and immersive combat and player personalization. It also now comes with a Co-op game mode where you and three other teammates hold off against a hoarde of zombie-like creatures.

EDIT:
With the new update and handover of Blacklight from Zombie Studios to Hardsuit Labs, the future looks everbright with BLR. While this game is always a work-in-progress, Blacklight Retribution provides you with an exciting experience and nonstop action... unless the servers go down.

I've sunk my life into this game and in turn, it has shown me inspiration towards my career; not as a gamer but as an aspiring developer. (No, I don't work for HSL... YET)

Also if you like Cyberpunk, Gundams, FPS, SAO's Gun Gale Online, Neon Genesis Evangelion and integrated wallhax, this game is for you.

NOTE:
Despite this game is a F2P, it is in no way a P2W... but just bring wads of cash anyways. It'll make you look cooler... permanantly.

reviewText:
BLR is a really solid, well balanced F2P FPS with tight control, innovative mechanics (in form of HRV - basically a wallhack availible to everyone) and astonishing customization options - stat-based part by part weapon customization, with same applied to armor. Almost every build is relevant in a way, and there are no pay to win elements, everything gameplay-relevant can be obtained via in-game currency (slightly grindy).

Unfortunately, being a F2P title, one would expect frequent updates and additional content, which isnt the case for a very long time now. Yes, there are new maps from time to time, most of them are just recycled from Zombie's previous title and are too far inbetween. Another problem new players may face is a strong veteran presence with really high skill ceiling (which was partially diminished in last few weeks with steady stream of new players).

When you get through these (mostly) service-related difficulties, you can expect a very tightly controlled, competitive and engaging FPS, where every your mistake is punished and you will never have a reason to blame anything else. (Also Siege" game mode is a jewel!)

Definitely try it."

reviewText:
Update 19. November 2015: A patch has just been released to fix stability issues and some other stuff. Hope is rising again.

A good game. I really loved it. The servers were always up (ok, hitreg wasn't working fluently, it rarely does in FPS multiplayer games though) and although it took some time to unlock items the system was fair and rewarding und the weapons were overall balanced.
Until, that is, Parity (a large update, the first one in years, came along). Parity was basically an unfinished update, with balance problems and nerfing recall to the point of non existance (almost). Private servers got removed and you can sprint indefinitely. Servers were down (or glitched, games just wouldn't start properly) way more frequently and latency was overall worse.
But it was ok, as the new devs seemed to be more active. Seemed. They promised regular updates. About monthly. There has been one noticable update since the Parity in August, which reintroduced some recoil. But so far nothing else.
Well, except unstable servers. Hitreg worse then ever. Higher pings (way higher). and as of now, missions down for a week. And the servers down again.
I still have hope for this game. Follow it and look for updates. Maybe all is not lost.

reviewText:
It's not a bad game however the devs have given up on fixing bugs.  No matter how fun the game is i cant give it thumbs up if its plagued with bugs.

Long time ago back in beta i played this game on my first computer.  It had a giant memory leak so i couldnt play it for more than 10 minutes at a time.   That system had 8 gigs of ram.

It has been 2 years since i last played the game and what do you know... the memory leak bug is still present.  My current system is has an i7-4790k 24gb ram and gtx980.

As far as the actual game play.  It's fun because there's so much customization available.  You can change tons of things on your weapon and everything makes a difference in the way the weapon actually functions.  Same with the gear.  But again, no matter how fun the gameplay is, if you cant actually play then what's the point?

Thanks for reading.

reviewText:
Overall: Blacklight: Retribution is a First Person Free to Play Multiplayer Shooter, or FPF2PMS for short.

Noteable: You have the ability to see through walls for a limited time in Blacklight.

Visual: Blacklight: Retribution is probably the best looking F2P game you will find on the market right now. It has great quality on textures and models and the effects also look great, the whole game is kept in a dark cyber version of modern urban enviroments. This might not be for everyone a good thing I personally however very much enjoyed the style of the game. The only thing that bugged me was the character models, they were good quality wise but just didn't float my boat.

Maps and Gameplay: The maps look great just like everything in this game, however I have found that while the design wasn't directly bad it didn't flow too well.  The gunplay itself is good though even if it lacks recoil. The spawn rotation made it too easy to get spawn killed by a random guy on the other team that might not even be such a great player, this is made even easier through the legal-wallhack" as some call it. It might seem unfair but since it is something everybody has available it is not in any way unbalanced. Unless you are playing on helodeck which is a small map with only three spawn points you should be fine though. One thing I particulary liked about the amount of customazition that can be done on guns and loadouts. Many options are offered for many guns.

Sound: The audio of this game is rather good however lacks interesting music(eg for the title screen) and oly has one dubstep-ish soundtrack.

Options: Oh my
date: the options menu is probably the best I have seen. It offers an extreme amount and detail in options\n\nFinance Model: In Blacklight: Retribution you have the ability to buy guns(and equipment) or rent them. This can be done via in-game or real world money. I don't want to get to deep into the matter what I can say is that you can gain pretty much everything through playing the game but while your 1st gun is fairly strong
recommended: opponents that  have put money into the game(and I mean alot
hoursPlayed: the guns are expensive) will have a slight advantage.\n\nConclusion: A very competent shooter
voteText: Blacklight: Retribution is a game for people that want to obsess over a game. If you are planning to drop-in and -out every once in a while then you should stay away from this game since the gifts you get for leveing up and renting guns both becomes completely worthless.\n\nP.S. The game has some technical issues but once you get to play it it's actually fun."

reviewText:
This Review is based on the post Parity Patch 2015.

I've been playing this game when it was still a new and niche game. I spent hours and hours on the game because it was that addicting. The gameplay was fast paced and really good. Until when Zombie Studio decided to shift their focus to the PS4 version leaving the PC version with no updates for 1 year.

Now with the Parity Patch 2015 the game is basically alive again. Slowly coming back to its former glory. Does it live up to its name now?

Gameplay : There are many things that have changed in the patch. Recoil is basically non-existant (To be changed IIRC) but it is still very easy to aim and shoot. The only thing that differs is the spread which does exist. Stamina was removed but instead replaced with unlimited sprinting which is nice. The game turns into fast paced cat and mouse game. Time To Kill is still very high since the game pretty much cranked it up to 11 thanks to the previously mentioned stuff.

Customisation : It feels awkward. As the interface is basically following the PS4 version of the game. I assume that the developers will change this in later updates but as of now it is very awkward. Having to go to separate menus just to change the receiver, muzzle, barrel and everything is cumbersome. Previously everything was on the same page and not having to press escape and click on another box for the correspondant customisation. Due to post parity patch inventory no longer exists and some stuff that was on the previous version went missing but it's fine. The pricing is waay better than before and since the game is following an unlock system because of no inventory it feels more streamlined.

Graphics : It's a hit and miss at the moment. The game looks the same for the most part but buggy at best. Textures popping at wrong times causing hitching while playing. It'll be fixed in the future updates.

Menu : Buggy mess but it works. Quick join works as intended but the browser is broken. Sometimes being able to join a server sometimes the browser just decides to pick a random server even though I clicked on the one that I want to play is annoying. This needs fixing asap. Oh and not to mention the hillarious 32 player servers ( I really wish they add this as a proper game mode) being in the game.

Final thoughts : Should you play this game? Yes. It is clear that the devs actually give a damn about the PC version again unlike another free to play shooter (I'm looking at you Loadout) and they are willing to spend time just to make sure that both sides of gaming is happy. The game will overwhelm you at first but give it few matches a try and you may just enjoy the game.

reviewText: First off. You might notice I have a number of hours on this game. This brings me to the first thing I do not like about this game. After you download the game, You do not get to play it, You have to wait for another download.. that is where my hours came from.. Now onto the game. When I first got into the game I was impressed, Seemed pretty good for A F2P, the graphics are nice, And there is not much wrong with the controls. But, After playing for awhile. I realised what A mistake It was to give this game a chance. The online community is rude.. Do not care about the other players experience. e.g. I spawned in got headshot before I could pull out my gun.. This game is very much Pay to win.. They try to hide it with the fact you can earn the guns, attachments and player customisation etc... Thats all good. But they absolutly screwed that by making all the higher leveled or Payed for guns completely OVERPOWERED!! And I do not say this lightly.. I would get into a gun fight with another player, I get the upper hand and shoot him first. He turns around and 1 shot later im dead and he walks away fine.. This completely destroys the gunplay. Sure there are alot of customisation options and you can make your gun all flashy.. Why not play TF2? Oh but thats not modern or Realistic..." you might say.. First off this game is not realistic in anyway if your reading to find that out. And At least with TF2 you can enjoy yourself and there is a friendly community. unlike in BlackLight where I get called "Gay" Because I asked why I was dieing so easily. Your better off paying for Battlefield or cod.. Also the maps are pretty bad. And the mech's are nothing to talk about. They can be taken down by a soilder. I do not recommend this game to any friends.. And I would like to note I did play this for a couple of hours on about 7-8 servers.. So I don't think it was bad luck. If you think it is "FUN" To die constantly and listen to 6yo kids who can't save enough money to buy a good game and rather but flashy attachments yell at you.. Go Ahead and download this game
date: But if your a normal person. Just buy a good game... That is my review. Hope it helps."

reviewText: Oh boy this game, I want to love it... I really do. I loved the first game: tango down. And despite it flaws it was my fix for anxbox arcade game! So when I heard about retribution and it being an F2P I immdetiantly jumped on the fanboy hype train straight to mediocrity! Now the gunplay, as is: is very fun and solid. The legal wallhack" as I like to call it keeps games fast and moving. But everything else is just god awful! Every single design choice zombie makes looks like they're taking it up the ♥♥♥ by their publisher rather than sticking out and doing what they want. People say the game isn't pay to win but it's damn close to it. It takes ages to unlock anything permanently so it encourages you waste 12 bucks just to waste it on 2 permanent weapons! And the balance is a lot like league of legends if you think about it: once they add something new
date: it's almost always op. There's no excuse to give this game a break for it being a free to play when games like dota 2 are out there and doing much better. The only redeeming quality to this is the uber customization options for your weapons and for the most part all weapon parts are side-grade (thank god) the game looks and run great and the combat feels very similar to cod's (in the good way and not the brown mushy crap kind of way) and lastly... ♥♥♥♥ING DUBSTEPS WUBWUBWUBWUBWUBWUBWUB!!! No
recommended: but seriously the soundtrack is pretty good and general level design is top notch and I find myself favouring most of the levels rather than ripping my hair out... I give the game a 5.5 A good attempt at a F2P but Zombie really ougtha try better next time
hoursPlayed: get a new publisher or go full indie... I can't recommend this game for personal reasons but I can understand why others would love this game."

Before you question how qualified I am to give you an accurate assessment of this game, I have (which I am not particularity proud of...lol) nearly 1000hrs of in game time to my record since it came to steam. Over 800 of these hours are on my brothers steam account, before you question the 300+ it shows here.  I know the game inside and out and have loved it and hated it throughout my experience playing.  That said, in an attempt to keep this game going steady and not having it fade out within another year, as so many other games have once people starting doing nothing but complaining on the review pages, I implore that new gamers try this great game.  And I mean give it an honest go.  You wont be overly good at it within 10 or 30 hrs of playing compared to all the other veterans playing it now, but you will get there if you enjoy it, and Im sure so many of you will.
It has a few downsides, such as a server problem, which though it is taking a while, they still say is in the works to getting resolved. However, worst case senario, a match will end and the game will lose connection.  Just rejoin or find another game.  You will still get everything you earned from that game.
No, acheivements dont really work.  But, as most if not all acheivments, they do nothing for the game.  They are just meaningless tokens to show your friends what you've spent your time doing.  The game is great without them.
There are, very occasional in my experience, hackers, but ALL games have them and youll never fully be rid of them.  This game has suprisingly few and if you legitimately find one, report and votekick them and the issue is resolved for you.
Those aside, ignore every other bad post out here threatening your time with this game.  They have very little ground to stand on.  I saw someone write a review saying they were banned for being too good.  I have been reported many times for being good, but never banned.  They can tell by the coding if you've been hacking or not.  So I question that persons honesty.  Were they really just good?  Or perhaps they weren't even banned.  Maybe something else happened, I don't know, but thats the first I've ever heard of something like that.
As for the game being dead?  It is NOT dead, but it has a small playerbase of die hards.  You can always find a game though, even if you have to wait in spectate mode for a moment and play with familiar people.  The games customer service and update progress is lacking.  But that is to be expected from PWE games and especially ones older than two years.
Im sure there is a bunch more I could say that is great about this game, but I want to leave it for You to discover, like the incredible customization features and smooth gameplay (though you may have to turn your graphics down if you have an older computer like I do), great graphics and much better net code than BF4 if anyone experienced that travesty.  Though that one isnt saying much.  :P
Also, Ignore anyone who says this is pay to win.  That is complete nonsense.  They do not understand the meaning of the words.  Aside from camo, there is nothing you can buy in this game for real money that you cannot earn by playing.  Even with all the gear in the game, it will not make you a better player.  Stock armour and the stock assault rifle are some of the best,  most well rounded gear in the game.  If you can't do well with them, gear will not help you.  And for those who say, but what about the heroes?" (which are premade characters basically)

reviewText:
This is a very well built game that has unfortunately fallen under the radar. I know I haven't really played much, but from what I can see, the devs are willing to take a chance unlike so many other FPS game devs out there. They show this by using, essentially, a wall hack.. There is a charge and you can't use your weapon but this helps make a very interesting game mechanic. This actually allows for strategy instead of run and gun because then you will just die because everyone sees you like a glaring error like a 9 in binary. The gunplay in this game is very satisfying. The guns actually feel like guns and the graphics are very nice.

The distinct future war torn setting gives it a very moody atmosphere and the art style is very pleasing to the eye. The graphics on this game are very nice, but I have to tone them down for a better fps so I can do better.

One annoying thing is the inventory system. If you've just downloaded Blacklight and you have no idea what you're doing, it can be very difficult to find out how to customize your loadout. I saw that I had got an smg and a combat rifle when i first logged in and I had no idea how to equip it. However, when it comes to competitive play, it's not going to be as good as casual because the people have played for soo long that they know exactly how to use the HRV (Hyper Reality Visor A.K.A the wall hack) so it's just a matter of who peeks the corner first. However this a very well built game that deserves more credit than many other fps games out there like Medal of Honour and Call of Duty. All in all, I give it an 8.8/10

One of the best pure shooters I know of. Gameplay modes are fairly typical for an online shooter, but where it really shines is in the controls. The gunplay feels smooth and polished, and almost every gun is unique and fun to play with.
Characters and weapons are customizable with options that can be purchased using in-game currency. You can opt to pay and unlock things sooner, or unlock them over time as you play, but unlike most games that use this model it never really feels like a disadvantage.
All weapons, down to the very first you get, are good for something and quite usable. Weapon choice becomes a matter of personal style, and you can try weapons very easily to find the right fit.
HRV, the game's most unique mechanic, feels like it should be in every shooter period.
By pressing V, the player briefly enters a mode that lets them see the location of other players.
It gives every player a general sense of where things are going on, where their team is, and where the enemies are.
It makes getting lost virtually impossible, and keeps players heading towards one another which leads to more action.
It becomes such a natural part of your playstyle that I'll often find myself mistakenly pushing V in other games on instinct. A fantastic pure shooter with an interesting twist or two, and controls that just feel right[/i].

After playing this game for over two years now...It seems it's time to do a review on Blacklight: Retribution. Let's start with content. In-game content is constantly being updated and released. There are also numerous events held by the community, ranging from double-exp events to weekly free item unlocks. With the addition of in-game achievements, it now gives the player goals throughtout matches to attain. The second thing I'd like to talk about is actual gameplay. With the HRV, camping is no longer an issue (Though you can turn it off for custom matches). The HRV also speeds up the gameplay. Knowing where everyone is, relatively, helps to more accurately elminate players without the drawn out process of looking for everyone. Weapons have their own special feel and every mod you add to them will affect this feel. Customization is huge in Blacklight as well. From your player to your gun; from your taunts (my favorite ;D) to your emblem- The world is yours. The system of unlocking things per level is fair as well as pricing on in-game items. THIS GAME IS NOT PAY-TO-WIN. Everything that is unlocked can be bought with GP as well as Zen (micro transactions). All in all; Blacklight: Retribution has captured my attention for two years now and I hope it gets even better into the future.

As far as multiplayer shooters go, this one is actually fairly unique - especially compared to its predecessor. The first Blacklight amounted to, more or less, Call of Duty in the future.  Retribution has built up much more than that, with not just with really slick visuals that scale well from the low to the high end, but also UNIQUE gameplay mechanics, extensive and MEANINGFUL customization of both your character and weapons, tight handling, and, of course, the price tag.\n\nThis is one of the highest-quality free games out there, and no, it is not pay-to-win. Even though equipment can be bought with cash, every piece has a statistical tradeoff. The default equipment is the base from which everything else is built and is the most general/versatile. Everything gameplay-changing can be obtained at a reasonable in-game credit price and you can try out equipment for a day at the price of a couple games' worth of credits to see if you want it. It's a great game with a very fair F2P model!
One of my favourite free-to-play FPS on steam!  It can run on lower end computers unlike Planetside 2.

Blacklight Retribution is a great F2P First-Person Shooter with great weapon and equipment customisation and a variety of classic game modes that we all love. The character customisation is awesome too, with lots of gear to choose from. The highlight of the game is the HRV (Hyper Reality Visor) system which allows you to essentially see through the maps environment, spotting allies, enemies and other objectives, which really mixes up the overall gameplay. I would recommend this game to anyone who likes lots of freedom to customise every aspect of their character, or any FPS lover in general.

BL:R in my opinion is one of the few F2P games out there that actually could rival store bought games. The HRV system adds a whole new level of difficulty to the standard FPS game, and if you don't like HRV, you can try out hardcore mode with no HRV. The newest patch being  Onslaught, has been great. The Co-Op mode has brought a new life to my want to play the game. Graphics are great when PWE actaully patches the game right. The patch just after Onslaught somehow allowed me to play with medium settings instead of low settings all the time. I give this game a good 4/5 stars. For them to get that extra star, I'd say they would have to crack down on making sure that the patches are good, that they don't wreak havok on the CPU performance.

Really Enjoyed this game, lots of fun. The game is really balanced for about the first 10 levels. Once you hit lvl 11 you will feel like the whole world + the moon are taking a big fat turd on your face. After a couple of levels it starts to balance it's self out again.

Back when I still had this game in my library, I played it at least once per weekend. While the concept is not the newest thing on the market, it's very well executed. Seeing as the game is free, I see no reason not to give it an install and try it yourself. While its very possible to go lone-wolf, Blacklight also has a strong emphasis on teamwork with the Hardsuit and HRV Gameplay mechanics, so you should definitely try to get your buddies to install the game along with you.

Six words: Your money won't save you.

If you are filthy rich but terrible at games, this is NOT for you.

Learn the tactics of the game and how to play properly and you'll be at the top of the team.

Pros
- No huge grind to get a good gun, most guns are bought through GP, earned through matches
- Guns are balanced just right
- If you are good, you will win.
- There are paid currency exclusive weps, but they all have upsides and downsides, just like regular weps.
- Fun, fast paced gameplay
- X-ray vision ability thrown at you right off the bat (awareness is key)

Cons
- Assault rifles are a tad overpowered, but easily countered by an SMG with a high rate of fire.
- Limited killstreak selection (health and ammo refill, rocket launcher, flamethrower, or mech suit)
- Snipers serve no purpose. At all. A huge percentage of the maps are close/medium quarters, too small for sniper gunplay.
Nice F2P game.
Worth the time I've spent on it.

It is a very, very competitive and fun game. It totally kicks Call of Duty's ♥♥♥ by a huge margin; The graphic quality, the level of customization, and unique features makes this game amazing. The only drawback are microtransaction; but even without paying for anything in the game you could get really far and well, as long as you're patient and skilled in FPS shooters. The new update really helps; it makes gaining GP (the points that buys/rents you weapons and gun mods) so much faster and easier. If you cant afford a gun, but have a lot of time to play, rent one! Then you could stack up enough GPs to actually buy it!:) Honestly, this game is very underrated because its a freemium; don't let that fool you though, this game rocks.

Graphic quality: 9 out of 10 (Pretty good for an FPS shooter)
Community: 8.5 out of 10 (Not many annoying people here; though some people make it pay-to-win)
Gameplay/Fun: 9 out of 10 (Takes a while to be bored; so many ways to play it. Be a sniper, run and gunner, tactical stealth play, you name it, its a game for many)

Best FPS you've never played. You guys are missing out on so much here, it's a shame!\n\nWeapon and character customization is amazing, and tools and loadout options are limteless. HRV makes this game absolutely unique and non-stop fun: http://blacklight.perfectworld.com/about/hrv

I would recommend Blacklight Retribution to any lover of FPS or rather, anyone that considers themselves a gamer. This is an extremely fast paced and competitive first person shooter. While the game boasts realistic graphics, a harsuit and a built in wall hack, none of these are extremely game breaking or significant. When it comes down to it, this is Call of Duty Black Ops 2 done right. The core gameplay is constantly entertaning and while updates are not exactly frequent, you won't mind it too much when you're destroying face.

And it is absolutely free. While this has been acclaimed as a pay-to-win game, this isn't necessarily the case. Some of the in-game missions give you up to 2000 GP for simply running around. When you level up (which does not take long) you recieve a temporary bundle of equipment so you can test out new equipment. I recently made a new account and I have since been topping the boards with only the beginner Assualt Rifle. Not to mention, the weekly hero and weapon have been extremely in my advancement to level 10.

Happy hunting agents!~

Ignore my time, i've played a lot more, i'm at level 41 right now.\nBLR has been the one free to play fps that i was looking for. I'll start by saying that the starting equipment is at the very center of average, which if you think about it, is a huge benefit due to versatility, the best of all worlds all rolled into your initial character, consider your first matches as practice, as you earn the in-game currency, (Which is given to you at a reasonable rate) You'll figure out the way YOU want to play, and you'll be able to tailor your gun and your armor to either make you move faster or take an extra hit while you're in the fray. There are so many minute variations in every single piece of equipment that your character can only end up being you. and the way you want to play.\nIf all that isn't enough the game looks gorgeous and is well optimized, even your old laptop can run this if you lower the settings. If you're ready to commit at least 2-3 hours a day BLR is the free to play shooter for you.

Major Yes

-Awesome Graphics (on par with retail games)
-Awesome gunplay Mechanics (you can aim down the sights, there are also many stats that effect you guns)
-Huge Replayability (... Look at my hours)
-Millions of gun possibilities (customizable sights, muzzles, stocks, magazines, barrels etc. - Also customizable armor)
-Many different multi-player modes and maps
-Balanced (guns are propperly balanced, making me usefull with any gun)

There's a lot more pros, but i can't think of them all. 10/10 my favourite f2p ever.

Blacklight is a fast-paced, action-packed, helluva shooter... is what I would say if I wanted to  be a corny summabich. I'm not good at writing reviews because I'm not good at wasting time so here's one thing I'll say about the game: If you have a good enough PC, Blacklight is an excellent, futuristic FPS that'll get you hook, line, and sinker with its deep customazation, awesome taunts, interesting melee weapons and outstanding leveling system. So this game supports a cheat which many gamer's don't want to include into other games they play and that cheat is WH ( or Wall Hack if you want the full meaning of it ), but nevermind the fact that the game uses Wall Hack , the game it self is Amazingly well done.

Gameplay: The gameplay is really good you might experience some glitches here and there but it wont cause the fact that you wont stop playing the game, the game has alot to offer ( - The fact the fact that you have to pay real money for that Zen cash which you wont get by playing loads and loads of matches everitime, so yeah some items require Zen payment and that will be a pain in the ♥♥♥ might sound as a Pay to Win game but I wouldn't quite call it that you know ) you can however buy rly cool guns for about 5000 to 6000 GP ( and that money wont take alot of time to collect believe me ) if you want permanently that is you can buy those guns for a lower and cheaper price of 1000 to 2000 GP but that will only last for about 3,7 to 30 days only and then its back to the boring guns again.

Sound: The sound system of this game is really cool, would give it a ratting of 9/10 ( might be some glitches but nevermind it you will enjoy the sound of the game )

Looks and Graphics: My looks for this game is that it is stunning, the graphics are well made and the details on the guns and characters are also well made, the game for me is breathtaking and i just love playing it alot of times.

So over all My ratting for this game would be a 9/10 Because you have some sound glitches and game glitches here and there but also one of the reasons why i gave it this ratting because of the Money you have to spend just to get some Zen Money to buy some difrent items in the game.

And yeah that is My Review for this game i hope you like it and i hope my English doesn't distract you with it :D See you guys again.

I've put more than the hours of 588 hours that Steam has entitled me to, cuase I've played the game before they made it on steam.
It was always updated back in the good times of this game, but now, Zombie Studio don't care too much about the PC gamers side to BLR. It's sad to me, as a loyal fan I've been to their Game, cause I feel that we've been abandoned and forgotten.
If you really want to experience the constant updates and fixes, go to their PlayStation3, but you will never see me there.

I still play the heck out of this game. It's fun, it's rare I run into hackers...
Everygame, however, someone is called a hacker... when really they are not hacking, lol. I'm a very good player at this game, and I see people getting called a hacker when really, they are just f'n good.

You will rage at this game. Just admit it, you will SUCK. However, the more game losses you have, the more you will learn quickly. You will STILL SUCK! lol. But eventually, you will finally grasp the game.

It's fun, not Pay2Win, your default weapon is OP, except the fact you only start out with a out-of-shape character and crappy iron sights. in close combat, make sure you use your hipfire.. it works great with the AR (Your default weapon)

Just expect some bugs and server crashes... cause like I said, PC gamers have been forgotten on this one.

I played this game a LOT and I had tons of hope for it but that has mostly run dry because of Zombie / PWE. It's still a good game and very fair to F2P players but the skill gap for a beginner to experienced will seem very daunting. It may seem that there are a bunch of people hacking but a good amount of active players are just that good. Most of the guns and gun parts are side grades with the dafault AR being the best gun in the game but it will still be annoying to die from cheese weapons like the prox mine, shurikens and exploding tomahawk. If you have not played it yet you may want to try it, the game is still fun just don't expect anything you don't like to ever be fixed.

Ok. So, i like this game. A lot. to put into reference, it blends to good parts of a lot of games. It feels a little like GR: Phantoms, has a mech like titanfall, has gun system out of loadout, etc. Now, it is a bit grindy, but i still havn't  felt any pressure to spend any real money on the game. And - with the default guns (and my trusty knife) i got top three a couple times (was 4th in squad most of the time) and MVP once (only been playing a few hours, mind you) against enemies of higher level (and scoring high than my own teamates who were higher level). Oh, and the kicker - you can see enemies through walls at any time - like the oracle ability out of phantoms, BUT it lasts for about a second and a half, you cant shoot during it, and it has a 5 or so second cooldown. What this means is, you spawn, know where to run to get action instead of boringly hunting for people, see someone, kill someone (piece of advice, pistol is much more lethal up close that an assault rifle, if you're in effective range, swap, the enemy probably wont, and you can hipfire them to death by emptying the mag in their lungs, and the basic assault rifle does almost nothing if you dont hit head, so, what i do is spray w/ rifle hipfire as i run up to them, then swap to pistol and finish them off, or punch them if they charge too.) then after killing them, you frantically sprint for some cubby hole to use as cover, hit the visor key, and spin quickly to see where the nearest enemy is all the while hoping that he isnt looking at you too. This game is incredibly skill based, not gearbased, just the last game i played (what inspired me to write this) was an event where i rounded a corner, and was staring down 3 level 8s (im level 3, remember) i panic-shot the first one and got his head - the other two took like a quarter of a second to react to my being behind them,  and as they spun around i swapped to pistol, spayed the next one down, started shooting the last one, and just as he was about to kill me (on like 5 health) he got about a step too close, and i punched him in the face. it felt amazing. Of course there was a guy behind me i didnt notice until i started to run for a cubbyhole who killed me like immediately after the experience, but i felt happy that i managed to kill three people who were over double my level with far better equipment.

So... with the story out of the way.... Time for the cons.

Sights are almost entirely useless, i won most engagments because i hipfired and the enemy took time to aim in - hipfire is accurate enough, and sights block too much of your view.

Six words: Your money won't save you.

If you are filthy rich but terrible at games, this is NOT for you.

Learn the tactics of the game and how to play properly and you'll be at the top of the team.

Pros
- No huge grind to get a good gun, most guns are bought through GP, earned through matches
- Guns are balanced just right
- If you are good, you will win.
- There are paid currency exclusive weps, but they all have upsides and downsides, just like regular weps.
- Fun, fast paced gameplay
- X-ray vision ability thrown at you right off the bat (awareness is key)

Cons
- Assault rifles are a tad overpowered, but easily countered by an SMG with a high rate of fire.
- Limited killstreak selection (health and ammo refill, rocket launcher, flamethrower, or mech suit)
- Snipers serve no purpose. At all. A huge percentage of the maps are close/medium quarters, too small for sniper gunplay.

Im way too biased to give a fair critic of this game coz it s one of my favourites but i just needed to recommend it to everyone. I play BLR since before they went onto Steam - Thats the reason for the few hours on record.

pros: The level of customisation, the very large variety of weapons-equipments, the energy of the combats, the brains you need to use thanks to the HRV, the tactical aspects, the beauty of the game, the fact that it s free!

cons: The community, the competitive side

All in all:
It is an amazing game that should be a lot more famous and appreciated! it just needs a bit of work on the competitive side which in turn will reinvigorate the community!!!

PS: Cant wait for the new update scheduled on 15th April!

Best FPS Free to Play game i played :D

This is a very well built game that has unfortunately fallen under the radar. I know I haven't really played much, but from what I can see, the devs are willing to take a chance unlike so many other FPS game devs out there. They show this by using, essentially, a wall hack.. There is a charge and you can't use your weapon but this helps make a very interesting game mechanic. This actually allows for strategy instead of run and gun because then you will just die because everyone sees you like a glaring error like a 9 in binary. The gunplay in this game is very satisfying. The guns actually feel like guns and the graphics are very nice.

The distinct future war torn setting gives it a very moody atmosphere and the art style is very pleasing to the eye. The graphics on this game are very nice, but I have to tone them down for a better fps so I can do better.

One annoying thing is the inventory system. If you've just downloaded Blacklight and you have no idea what you're doing, it can be very difficult to find out how to customize your loadout. I saw that I had got an smg and a combat rifle when i first logged in and I had no idea how to equip it. However, when it comes to competitive play, it's not going to be as good as casual because the people have played for soo long that they know exactly how to use the HRV (Hyper Reality Visor A.K.A the wall hack) so it's just a matter of who peeks the corner first. However this a very well built game that deserves more credit than many other fps games out there like Medal of Honour and Call of Duty. All in all, I give it an 8.8/10

i've been playing this game since beta and i've always loved it. the game before the update was a bit sloppy in the interface, wasn't really user friendly but now? it's very manageable. Many items in the store can be bought with real money but also with the in game currency (GP) which makes the game not a pay to win game. kind of like the League of Legends store. There aren't a vast amount of selection of guns but what shines is the customization of them. There are so many possible outcomes of guns that you can do to suit your preference.  Armor is also customizable to your liking in terms of health, running speed, etc. Leveling and getting currency may seem slow at first but comparing them to other shooters that involve the same type of buy/upgrade weps, it's about the same. Also, camping doesn't exist in this game =D

i give this game 10/10. Def worth a try

great f2p alternative to CoD, Halo, and all those other top shooters

Graphics: 9.5/10 (No joking here, for a F2P game, these are the best graphics I've seen in a while)
Gameplay: 9/10 (Would've gave it a 9.5 if they added death ragdolls and some type of virtual throwing arc for grenades and tomahawks, but otherwise the recoil is great, weapons are fluid and unique, and the spread system is glorious)
Story: 7/10 (Really? This game doesn't need a story, but it has one. Not the best, but still, it has one)
Economy/P2W Factor: 9.5/10 (Seriously, it's like this game throws P2W out of the window. Sure, you can pay with real life money, but everything in this game is neither a downside, or an upside. The only things you can only get with real life currency are 90% of camos and heroes, which again, no real upgrade. By economy, I mean the ammount of in-game currency needed to purchase attachements, guns and such. If you're smart and do missions, then getting a good piece of equipment takes about 2-3 days of 4 to 5 hours of playtime.)

All in all, Blacklight: Retribution still holds a special place in my Steam library, and I'm dead sure it'll hold one in yours as well.

In a world today of futuristic shooters, I feel BLR has started it wayyyy before this 'future shooter boom' even spawned. I've played BLR way back in Beta and loved it! However the F2P model then didn't make any sense to me and CS:GO had came out shortly after, So I had kind of dropped BLR all the way. Finally picked it back up earlier in 2016, revived my old account and wiped the dust off. I must say that BLR has come a long way since Beta. Even after the Parity Patch it still stands out as an FPS. New game modes, decently healthy server population, and a very good and genuine community that you wont find anywhere else in any other FPS. Best of all, it's FREE TO PLAY! So jump on and have a ball with legit wall hacks. (HRV) You can do a hefty amount of grinding to save GP to purchase items and weapons permanently, OR you could drop $20 into this game and already make a good amount of things permanent. Honestly, I feel this game could be worth even $40 with the amount of options and customisation you get. PLUS the best thing is, it supports this game and keeps it alive for F2Pers and Payers alike. Amazing game that'll keep you addicted to customisation as well as having a ball when you get dropped into a match. Absolutely recommend it regardless of what others are saying about the Parity Patch.

TL;DR?
Disregard what other reviews are saying and just download this game for yourselves. Form your OWN opinion on it. It's free to play. C'mon you aren't losing anything besides a few GB off of your hard drive.. In that case if you hate it, uninstall it. It's that simple. Form your own opinions and check this game out today. That's all I can really say guys.

Well, I only played few hours, but P2W hits hard over here. For example: if you are a newbie, you are gonna be throwed in with better players (they have 22 lvl, 26 lvl) and they all bought weapons with money. As a veteran of CS:GO, recoil is important in shooting mechanic, but this is just CoD level, no recoil at all! You just go around the map and kill everybody without aiming down your sights, because it doesn't do much. This game yells: GRINDING. This is one of those games, in which you can buy a gun for a day for a small price, BUT if you want to buy it PERMANENTLY, you have to GRIND, or pay some premium coin sh*t to get it. For one permanent weapon you need to pay 8000 GP. After a match (I play deathmatch, because it's where I get the most GP) you'll get 10-50, 80-120 if you are a winner, or atleast you did good. You have to constantly grind, and grind.

TL;DR
Game is fun, P2W is strong with this one, if you are bored, play this game or if you like grinding. It is kind of addicting, but I wouldn't spend alot of time, because there are alot F2P games, that are far better than this one. 7/10 not more.

So I guess I'll finally write a recommendation on this... Blacklight: Retribution is by far the best online FPS I've played. Tight gameplay, high production values, one of the most fair F2P models out there with bare minimal amount of pay to win. Oh, and you can build your own guns! Blacklight: Retribution is awesome.
If Cod: Advanced Warfare and Halo had a baby it would be this game 8/10! :D

Blacklight Retribution is a great F2P First-Person Shooter with great weapon and equipment customisation and a variety of classic game modes that we all love. The character customisation is awesome too, with lots of gear to choose from. The highlight of the game is the HRV (Hyper Reality Visor) system which allows you to essentially see through the maps environment, spotting allies, enemies and other objectives, which really mixes up the overall gameplay. I would recommend this game to anyone who likes lots of freedom to customise every aspect of their character, or any FPS lover in general.

reviewText: This game barely got a recommendation. Tons of grinding and hours upon hours is required to be atleast comparable with other veteran players. Once you have had around 20-30 hours into the game it becomes quite easy to grasp on as now you should be able to match most players out there. Graphics is top notch for a free to play game, and the gameplay is smooth and addictive. This game's model of free to play is considerable, as you are able to buy most of the guns and customizations without shelling out real money. But it requires a lot of in game currency in order to do so, and if you dont have the twitch shooting skill of a 12 years old on Spring break, youre gonna have a hard time getting along with the game.

Tried to play the game but was required to first register an account on ARC.

Register on the website using Facebook account.

No option to login to Steam ARC client with Facebook.

Can't create an account with my email because I used my Facebook.

1/10

Totally Bugged right now, if you want to join a game you simply can't. And if you somehow manage to get into one you get a stationary cam and tons of deaths because you fell off the map. Oh yeah and for some reason 2 servers work but you can't join even tho there are 11/16 agent playing.\n\nGreat game without that.

Game has ALOT of issues, the sprinting in the game doesn't feel 'natural' compared to most FPS games I've played such as BF & CoD. The HRV system is innovative and all which eliminated the use of maps in the game, however, UI maps were there for a reason. While using the HRV though, it made you vulnerable to attacks as the person you are seeing through it is coming around the corner which decreases your reaction time to engagement. In addition to the game's issues, there is a lack of new content maps, no new gear,no new weapons, no new armor,no new mechs... nothing. The player community is also lacking, you pretty much hit 'Quick Join' and you find yourself playing a game mode with all the players currently online... want to play team deathmatch or Kill Confirmed? Nope, sorry... you will find yourself in an empty lobby in one of those game modes. Aside from the negatives, the game has nice aesthetics, great customization features, and freaking MECHS! Listen to the Veteran reviews of this game, its pretty accurate, getting sniped by a damn pistol is no fun at all...

reviewText: This funny, sexually charged game shows you that life not only continues after 50 but is actually rich, fulfilling, and, most of all, fun -- especially when you have good friends to share it with. Dating, sexual activity, adultery, abortion, and AIDS are some of the many issues you face. This game also shows you many aspects of aging, which range from the comical (sagging chests, drooping bottoms) to the serious (rising health care costs) to the tragic (the rising incidence of homelessness among seniors). But it is also a celebration of life, reminding you that women in their golden years are strong, sexy, and beautiful.

reviewText:
Although some may call it a dying game, there is still a large community to back this game up.  If you looking for a fast paced shoot-em-up, this is your game. Make sure you bring friends though as getting through the first levels is easy but later leves it gets increasinly hard and, without friends, quite long.

If you're playing on Official Servers, there is a mode, which, to some users will seem reckless, called HRV, which is just a time limited wall hack. There are ways to hid yourself from this 'hack' but as with most other things in the game, have to be renewed constantly.

Although you can call this game Pay to Win"
date: everything in this game which affects the outcome of any match can be bought using the in game currency that is earned by playing matches. Opposite of levels
recommended: you will earn little at first forcing you to constantly repurchase stuff
hoursPlayed: but after a while you will be earning so much you won't know what to do with all of it.  Another point to make is that

reviewText: Awesome game 10/10 would bang it :D

You don't realise how inaccurate all the guns are untill you buy the 6x scope, Constantly fighting to make your guns feel just right... But once you put all the right peices together, it feels amazing, although it may take awhile to unlock all the parts. The only thing that real money can buy, is boosters to help gain what you can get for FREE faster, apparel type stuff, or boxes which you open and get a random prize.

As a CS:GO player, I dislike how inaccurate the first shot is on the guns, but you can get it pretty damn close if you sacrifice all your damage, making it so you can be a headshot master.

Reasons to go back to this game since its first launch:

-They also recently changed it so you can PERMANENTLY buy ammo mods, so you no longer have to rent ammo. (which was kinda a p2w thing back in the day)
-They added quite a few new maps
-They added about twice as many levels to the leveling system, which means more unlockables.
-The cost of Weapon parts was signifigantly decreased, 1000GP a part, so you can get a permanent weapon peice after about 3 - 4 games.

Summary:

If you make an extremely accurate, low damage gun, and can pull off headshots on jumping/moving targets, you can wreck all the call of duty kids.

This game is so fast paste and rewarding it's not a run around the map and shoot anything you see, You have to use your wall hack vision to see where the enemy is and plan your next move because camping or carelessly running around the map looking for a kill will get you eating the cold nasty ♥♥♥ dirt, the game isn't pay to win but permanent items are still expensive but if you do well in gameplay and communicate with your team you will get the things you want and need.  The only thing i got a problem with this game is the spawn points and that the game crashes once in a while, still the game is very fun and it's free so i suggest you try it now if you want a more challenging and intense exprience.\n\n10/10 Game has dubstep <3

Its is a very stable game that has been recieving regular maintenince and has wonderful communnity managers supporting it (i.e. Domino, Lord Alf...). The game is basically a free to play Call of Duty with insane customization and built in wall hacks that set it aside from other generic first person shooters. I give Blacklight: Retribution an amateur score of 9/10. Don't pass up playing this game.

reviewText: Firstly, on a positive note, i think this game is a great fps and has nice graphics and all that jazz, but there are some distinct negatives that make you think twice about playing the game - for example - on all of the 5 computers that i have tried this game on, alll of them crashed at one point or another when directX 11 was turned on, and after reserching on this problem, i found out that this was the first game that Unreal Technologies implemented DX11, which is most likely the cause.Considering that only with DX11 you have the ability to tesselate, i think this is a key and major flaw with the game, so if that issue was adreesed and looked into by Zombie studios, it would be greatly appreciated. The second issue is alot more specific to a particular game mode, the one which Blacklight is most famous for, Onslaught. In this game mode (which i find very good as it allowed the players to not only combat with one type of zombie, but a variety) there are some zombies at the end of each round who, at their spawn point, stay still until killed regarless of the players position on the map, whether it be on the other side, or standing directly infront. This issue is minor, but it is an issue none the less. Finnaly, there is another flaw that i find with the game which involves the servers. After playing a while on a particular server, on a particular game ending ( usually after playing for a while ) the server, before you go to the cut scene of you standing on the right side of the screen and you see all the xp and gp you earned that match, the game will close down, saying The connection to the server has been lost" after this message
date: you are re-directed to the servers list where the server that you were playing on still shows players in it
recommended: as if you were the only one that lost connection ( mind you that you get all the xp and gp after the match
hoursPlayed: however the awards such as chance packs you don't redeem unless you go to the main menue
voteText: where you will then recieve the awards in the usual fashion ) However
helpfulPercent: once you re-join that server you find no-one else to be in the server - everyone lost connection simultaneously. Although this happens at the end of a particular round
votesHelpful: this happens regardless and is very distruptive to a game and annoying for the players who find a server that they like to be full
votesTotal: only for everyone to lose connection andthe server to be empty untill someone else joins.\n\nTo summarise
votesFunny: Blacklight:Retribution is a great game
commentsCount: but Zombie Studios still need to address the issues stated abve so as to make this game work to it's full potential
column16: making the game more popular and thus Zombie Studios will be happy because they will generate a higher income from this game and so will the consumers as they will have higher quality content to enjoy.\n\nZombie Studios
column17: please take the afformentioned issues to heart so this game may thrive.\n\nRegards

reviewText:
Graphics: 9.5/10 (No joking here, for a F2P game, these are the best graphics I've seen in a while)
Gameplay: 9/10 (Would've gave it a 9.5 if they added death ragdolls and some type of virtual throwing arc for grenades and tomahawks, but otherwise the recoil is great, weapons are fluid and unique, and the spread system is glorious)
Story: 7/10 (Really? This game doesn't need a story, but it has one. Not the best, but still, it has one)
Economy/P2W Factor: 9.5/10 (Seriously, it's like this game throws P2W out of the window. Sure, you can pay with real life money, but everything in this game is neither a downside, or an upside. The only things you can only get with real life currency are 90% of camos and heroes, which again, no real upgrade. By economy, I mean the ammount of in-game currency needed to purchase attachements, guns and such. If you're smart and do missions, then getting a good piece of equipment takes about 2-3 days of 4 to 5 hours of playtime.)

All in all, Blacklight: Retribution still holds a special place in my Steam library, and I'm dead sure it'll hold one in yours as well.

Although the game is reat gameplay wise, it lacks ingenuity. The game already feels old once you play it more than one time. Buying items is also frustrating since you're using in-game currency to RENT (yes, RENT) items temporary. This makes the game difficult to play, and yet frustrating because you also have to deal with players who know their ♥♥♥♥, and have at least blew $50.00 just to get the gear that they want. As a noob who is curious into the first-person shooter genre, you wouldn't want to buy this game until you familarize with most first-person shooters. As an expert, you'll do wonders to this game. Like I said, the gameplay of this game is fun and you can play with bots if you need to practice, however, you won't gain any experience or gold for doing practice rounds.\n\nSo in order to get experience and gold to RENT" better items

i've been playing this game since beta and i've always loved it. the game before the update was a bit sloppy in the interface, wasn't really user friendly but now? it's very manageable. reviewText: Blacklight Retribution is a fantastic game and as one of the beta testers in 2012 and a player of Tango down i have played and grown with this game for a majority of my life and have i loved the journey. the start of the game where you had to report glitches was like a quest for me looking in every nook and cranny for bugs and experimenting with the weapons for hours i am feeling sad to see the old game go away but now that the new game is coming out it should hopefully be better as BLR was dying recently but it seems to not be forgotten. now that my life history is complete i will actually make a review about the game. 1. gameplay 8.5/10 reason: there were some glitches with hit reg and so on but all in all great gameplay. 2. customisation 9.5/10 reason: cant give anything 10/10 and game could have a few more changes but compared to other games this is one of the best games for customisation even better than COD and BF4 in some aspects. 3. aestheics 8/10 reason: camos werent the best and wasnt too many premium rare skins like for a golden oldie like me so i was a bit sad but good textures in the map. 4. community(late 2013-mid 2015) 7.5/10 reason: game had a few hackers after 2 years but they got banned pretty much as soon as they got reported there was a crackdown police team on almost 24/7 so there were very few bad games where hackers spoiled everything. 5.overall 8.5/10 reason: the game is one of the best freetoplay games i have seen in my large gaming career and it matches the big boys so it shows that the crew were working hard in the beginning but as the game progressed the game sorta shut down and with the arrival of the PS4 edition it meant that the dev team left the PC version in the dust but only for like 2 months and with the arrival of what i would say is a better crew (no offense Zombie studios i love you still) it means that BLR will be revived and will reach what i can safely say will be the peak of its glory. -a lone beta tester that hides in the shadows...\n\nwill be writing a review after i reach max rank in the updated BLR see ya all on the other side soldiers, general badass signing out.

After playing this game for nearly 2-3 years, having my views on this game change  multiple times and even spending cash on it, here are my thoughts.

pros:
-customizations.
Almost everything about your weapon can be customized in the game.
From your gun parts, to your armor to the things you carry as extras to battle.

-not one gun is the same
Guns in this game arent bought. they are built by you. you choose the parts, assemble them, and you get your dream gun to suit your play style. even if you built a gun exactly like someone else, it wout be exactly the same because of the trinklets they put on theirs.

-your own play style
because of the way the you built your gun, your play style varies alot. even allowing you hybrid rush/flank/camp and even lay traps on some game modes.

-walhack?
well not exactly. the HRV mechanics in the game is cool to prevent alot of camping, but its still possible to camp by countering the HRV with specific loadouts. The HRV also prevents you from shooting or doing anything except for moving when it's active and there is a short startup and cool down animation.

-Friendly Community
people are nice. not noob mean and they wont bash you for no apparent reason. but with all community, there are a few exceptional jackholes who are out to ♥♥♥♥ you off. just ignore those few and its gonna be fine.


Cons:
-Bugs after parity patch.
we were all very happy about the patch bringing in new content. but we arent expecting all the bus that came along with it. Onslaught didnt always work, private servers are never up previously, and the lack of a global chat killed the community involvment.

-individual gun parts
gun parts used to be universal. if u bought a part for gun A, and gun B is also compatible, you can use it on gun B too.
now you gotta buy the same parts TWICE if you wanna use it on gun B. and that sucks.

-improper recoil after the patch.
first time in my entire life i was able to build a full damage LMG and can still shoot in a straight line while spraying. I didnt believe what others said about the new recoil at frist, until i tried it out myself. it was funny tho.


Overall, this game WAS fun. the new content that the parity patch bought in killed the game event more. it wasnt what we were expecting, it gave us hope only to cheat us on it. and it came too late. alot of good and skillful players have left the game and now I guess its finally my turn. the game is still able to give you a few good hours of fun, but only if you already have friends playing on it. this game had potential to be more, and Hardsuit Labs kinda threw that potential away.
It is a really good Free 2 Play Firstpersonshooter. It is not Pay 2 Win, but it is really Laggy.

It was fun while it lasted.
There are plenty of people complaining about the changes they've made to this game, so I'm going to unhelpfully add to that heap.
I haven't played for long at all, but I came back after every few updates just to see how things were going. But it just got worse and worse.
It wasn't pay to win at first. The weapons were fairly balanced. The sci-fi theme was nice and fine the way it was.
For some reason, that all changed. And the 'community' there is hopeless.

This game isn't the worst of the worst, it just scrapes across as 'Okay'. If you've played this game a few years ago and looking to come back to it - it's not the same.
It is an extremely fun game. It is a bit harder to play than your average fps. The customization options for weapon and gear is awesome! I'd give this game a 7 1/2 out of 10.

Alright, This game is one of the best shooters I've played in my life. About a year ago I was looking for a futuristic shooter on steam. Later I came across this game, and sure enough I made an amazing descision of downloading this game. This game deserves a lot more attention than it has now and I highly recommend it. Also this game is amazing to be free to play! By far the best F2PFPS along with Planetside 2 of course :P.\n\nI give Blacklight a 10/10

I really do enjoy this game. It adds stuff most shooters don't have. Enemy team closing in on your buddy? No matter, raise your hand to your head and you can see  every single enemys position! Although, you have a time limit for how long you can see where your enemys are, before you have to recharge it. It really makes it a fair game for almost everyone, despite the fact that most of the guns are very, very, VERY expensive and require a lot of grinding. It is not a game for the impatient, if you can not handle playing for a couple of days on end grinding to get your guns, then I don't recommend it for you. I do however, recommend it to patient people/grinders. Anyway, thats just my opinion on it, if you don't like it, or if you do like it, then whatever! I just hope I helped people decide whether or not to try it out!

reviewText: Game has ALOT of issues, the sprinting in the game doesn't feel 'natural' compared to most FPS games I've played such as BF & CoD. The HRV system is innovative and all which eliminated the use of maps in the game, however, UI maps were there for a reason. While using the HRV though, it made you vulnerable to attacks as the person you are seeing through it is coming around the corner which decreases your reaction time to engagement. In addition to the game's issues, there is a lack of new content maps, no new gear,no new weapons, no new armor,no new mechs... nothing. The player community is also lacking, you pretty much hit 'Quick Join' and you find yourself playing a game mode with all the players currently online... want to play team deathmatch or Kill Confirmed? Nope, sorry... you will find yourself in an empty lobby in one of those game modes. Aside from the negatives, the game has nice aesthetics, great customization features, and freaking MECHS! Listen to the Veteran reviews of this game, its pretty accurate, getting sniped by a damn pistol is no fun at all...

As you can see on my hours on this game I am an experience player, I've been been playing almost everyday for like a year, this is a great game but the devs retired and it got took over, now this is a huge change.
Pay to win? not at all, you can buy almost anything with GP (game points), it just takes a while for you to get it.
Community is being a little.. I'll keep it nice, I had over 130.000 gp.. any player who reads this knows that takes a lot grinding, I once logged in and it was all gone :p there are many people who will scream that you are aimbotting so you better get prepared.
Overall it's a pretty game, it runs great, and with great I mean over 60 fps anytime on ultra settings on my amd card.
Servers can be very buggy and laggy, sometimes they dont work.. lack of updates are a bummer too! but we all hope this will change once they got it all straighten out.
I really had fun playing, I still do but it get's old after half an year.. but I do recommand the game!
8/10, I'd play again.

I waver on this one.
This game could be great if there was still any effort being put into it.
I love the graphics, atmosphere, the ability to customize weapons to your liking and play style.

Unfortunately, it is pretty obvious that this game has, at the very least, been put on the back burner.
As evidenced by the fact their achievements have not worked since 2012 and nobody has fixed it.
Yes, I know... one does not need" achievements.
Sure they can be fun to earn
date: and many games do not have them and are still quite enjoyable
recommended: even this one I would say...\nHowever
hoursPlayed:
it sends a pretty dim message of the game's future viability and replayability when something so simple goes ignored for so long.

This seems little more than a way for them to nickle and dime folks with micro-transactions while justifying a hands-off approach to development and maintenance under the banner of "Free to Play".
There are simply other games that do a comparable job to what this game does that have not been abandoned.
So why would I recommend this one?
Best I can offer is "It is free to try but I wouldn't drop a dime on their market knowing they aren't doing anything to earn it.""

This is one of my favorite F2P (free to play) games, despite it being slightly favoring P2W (pay to win) players.  The gameplay and graphics are extremely refined, the maps and gametypes are all interesting and it has better production value overall than some bigger profile games.  The biggest downside is the god awful interface for managing items and getting new ones.  There are tabs and sliders everywhere with no rhyme or reason.  The other aspect of the interface is buying" items and weapons in game because they tend to only last for a few days and then have to be discarded and builds remade.  It's not a dealbreaker level of an issue
date: but it does add annoyance to a game that has a lot going for it."
